79 // The following version macro is very similar to the one in pybind11
80 #if !(defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
81 #if __cplusplus >= 201402L
82 #define CLI11_CPP14
83 #if __cplusplus >= 201703L
84 #define CLI11_CPP17
85 #if __cplusplus > 201703L
86 #define CLI11_CPP20
87 #endif
88 #endif
89 #endif
90 #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && __cplusplus == 199711L
91 // MSVC sets _MSVC_LANG rather than __cplusplus (supposedly until the standard is fully implemented)
92 // Unless you use the /Zc:__cplusplus flag on Visual Studio 2017 15.7 Preview 3 or newer
93 #if _MSVC_LANG >= 201402L
94 #define CLI11_CPP14
95 #if _MSVC_LANG > 201402L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
96 #define CLI11_CPP17
97 #if _MSVC_LANG > 201703L && _MSC_VER >= 1910
98 #define CLI11_CPP20
99 #endif
100 #endif
101 #endif
102 #endif
103 
104 #if defined(CLI11_CPP14)
105 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) [[deprecated(reason)]]
106 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
107 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __declspec(deprecated(reason))
108 #else
109 #define CLI11_DEPRECATED(reason) __attribute__((deprecated(reason)))
110 #endif
111 
112 // GCC < 10 doesn't ignore this in unevaluated contexts
113 #if !defined(CLI11_CPP17) || \
114  (defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__llvm__) && !defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && __GNUC__ < 10 && __GNUC__ > 4)
115 #define CLI11_NODISCARD
116 #else
117 #define CLI11_NODISCARD [[nodiscard]]
118 #endif
119 
121 #ifndef CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI
122 #if(defined(_HAS_STATIC_RTTI) && _HAS_STATIC_RTTI)
123 #define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
124 #elif defined(__cpp_rtti)
125 #if(defined(_CPPRTTI) && _CPPRTTI == 0)
126 #define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
127 #else
128 #define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 0
129 #endif
130 #elif(defined(__GCC_RTTI) && __GXX_RTTI)
131 #define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 0
132 #else
133 #define CLI11_USE_STATIC_RTTI 1
134 #endif
135 #endif

139 #define CLI11_INLINE
140 #else
141 #define CLI11_INLINE inline
142 #endif

145 
146 // C standard library
147 // Only needed for existence checking
148 #if defined CLI11_CPP17 && defined __has_include && !defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM
149 #if __has_include(<filesystem>)
150 // Filesystem cannot be used if targeting macOS < 10.15
151 #if defined __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED && __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED < 101500
152 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
153 #elif defined(__wasi__)
154 // As of wasi-sdk-14, filesystem is not implemented
155 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
156 #else
157 #include <filesystem>
158 #if defined __cpp_lib_filesystem && __cpp_lib_filesystem >= 201703
159 #if defined _GLIBCXX_RELEASE && _GLIBCXX_RELEASE >= 9
160 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
161 #elif defined(__GLIBCXX__)
162 // if we are using gcc and Version <9 default to no filesystem
163 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
164 #else
165 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 1
166 #endif
167 #else
168 #define CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM 0
169 #endif
170 #endif
171 #endif
172 #endif
173 
174 #if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
175 #include <filesystem> // NOLINT(build/include)
176 #else
177 #include <sys/stat.h>
178 #include <sys/types.h>
179 #endif

188 namespace enums {
189 
191 template <typename T, typename = typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type>
192 std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &in, const T &item) {
193  // make sure this is out of the detail namespace otherwise it won't be found when needed
194  return in << static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(item);
195 }
196 
197 } // namespace enums
198 
200 using enums::operator<<;
201 
202 namespace detail {
205 constexpr int expected_max_vector_size{1 << 29};
206 // Based on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/236129/split-a-string-in-c
208 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string &s, char delim);
209 
211 template <typename T> std::string join(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
212  std::ostringstream s;
213  auto beg = std::begin(v);
214  auto end = std::end(v);
215  if(beg != end)
216  s << *beg++;
217  while(beg != end) {
218  s << delim << *beg++;
219  }
220  return s.str();
221 }
222 
224 template <typename T,
225  typename Callable,
226  typename = typename std::enable_if<!std::is_constructible<std::string, Callable>::value>::type>
227 std::string join(const T &v, Callable func, std::string delim = ",") {
228  std::ostringstream s;
229  auto beg = std::begin(v);
230  auto end = std::end(v);
231  auto loc = s.tellp();
232  while(beg != end) {
233  auto nloc = s.tellp();
234  if(nloc > loc) {
235  s << delim;
236  loc = nloc;
237  }
238  s << func(*beg++);
239  }
240  return s.str();
241 }
242 
244 template <typename T> std::string rjoin(const T &v, std::string delim = ",") {
245  std::ostringstream s;
246  for(std::size_t start = 0; start < v.size(); start++) {
247  if(start > 0)
248  s << delim;
249  s << v[v.size() - start - 1];
250  }
251  return s.str();
252 }
253 
254 // Based roughly on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25829143/c-trim-whitespace-from-a-string
255 
257 CLI11_INLINE std::string &ltrim(std::string &str);
258 
260 CLI11_INLINE std::string &ltrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter);
261 
263 CLI11_INLINE std::string &rtrim(std::string &str);
264 
266 CLI11_INLINE std::string &rtrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter);
267 
269 inline std::string &trim(std::string &str) { return ltrim(rtrim(str)); }
270 
272 inline std::string &trim(std::string &str, const std::string filter) { return ltrim(rtrim(str, filter), filter); }
273 
275 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str) {
276  std::string s = str;
277  return trim(s);
278 }
279 
281 CLI11_INLINE std::string &remove_quotes(std::string &str);
282 
287 CLI11_INLINE std::string fix_newlines(const std::string &leader, std::string input);
288 
290 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
291  std::string s = str;
292  return trim(s, filter);
293 }
295 CLI11_INLINE std::ostream &
296 format_help(std::ostream &out, std::string name, const std::string &description, std::size_t wid);
297 
299 CLI11_INLINE std::ostream &format_aliases(std::ostream &out, const std::vector<std::string> &aliases, std::size_t wid);
300 
303 template <typename T> bool valid_first_char(T c) { return ((c != '-') && (c != '!') && (c != ' ') && c != '\n'); }
304 
306 template <typename T> bool valid_later_char(T c) {
307  // = and : are value separators, { has special meaning for option defaults,
308  // and \n would just be annoying to deal with in many places allowing space here has too much potential for
309  // inadvertent entry errors and bugs
310  return ((c != '=') && (c != ':') && (c != '{') && (c != ' ') && c != '\n');
311 }
312 
314 CLI11_INLINE bool valid_name_string(const std::string &str);
315 
317 inline bool valid_alias_name_string(const std::string &str) {
318  static const std::string badChars(std::string("\n") + '\0');
319  return (str.find_first_of(badChars) == std::string::npos);
320 }
321 
323 inline bool is_separator(const std::string &str) {
324  static const std::string sep("%%");
325  return (str.empty() || str == sep);
326 }
327 
329 inline bool isalpha(const std::string &str) {
330  return std::all_of(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char c) { return std::isalpha(c, std::locale()); });
331 }
332 
334 inline std::string to_lower(std::string str) {
335  std::transform(std::begin(str), std::end(str), std::begin(str), [](const std::string::value_type &x) {
336  return std::tolower(x, std::locale());
337  });
338  return str;
339 }
340 
342 inline std::string remove_underscore(std::string str) {
343  str.erase(std::remove(std::begin(str), std::end(str), '_'), std::end(str));
344  return str;
345 }
346 
348 CLI11_INLINE std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from, std::string to);
349 
351 inline bool has_default_flag_values(const std::string &flags) {
352  return (flags.find_first_of("{!") != std::string::npos);
353 }
354 
355 CLI11_INLINE void remove_default_flag_values(std::string &flags);
356 
358 CLI11_INLINE std::ptrdiff_t find_member(std::string name,
359  const std::vector<std::string> names,
360  bool ignore_case = false,
361  bool ignore_underscore = false);
362 
365 template <typename Callable> inline std::string find_and_modify(std::string str, std::string trigger, Callable modify) {
366  std::size_t start_pos = 0;
367  while((start_pos = str.find(trigger, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
368  start_pos = modify(str, start_pos);
369  }
370  return str;
371 }
372 
375 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str, char delimiter = '\0');
376 
381 CLI11_INLINE std::size_t escape_detect(std::string &str, std::size_t offset);
382 
384 CLI11_INLINE std::string &add_quotes_if_needed(std::string &str);
385 
386 } // namespace detail

390 
391 namespace detail {
392 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string &s, char delim) {
393  std::vector<std::string> elems;
394  // Check to see if empty string, give consistent result
395  if(s.empty()) {
396  elems.emplace_back();
397  } else {
398  std::stringstream ss;
399  ss.str(s);
400  std::string item;
401  while(std::getline(ss, item, delim)) {
402  elems.push_back(item);
403  }
404  }
405  return elems;
406 }
407 
408 CLI11_INLINE std::string &ltrim(std::string &str) {
409  auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [](char ch) { return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()); });
410  str.erase(str.begin(), it);
411  return str;
412 }
413 
414 CLI11_INLINE std::string &ltrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
415  auto it = std::find_if(str.begin(), str.end(), [&filter](char ch) { return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos; });
416  str.erase(str.begin(), it);
417  return str;
418 }
419 
420 CLI11_INLINE std::string &rtrim(std::string &str) {
421  auto it = std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [](char ch) { return !std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()); });
422  str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
423  return str;
424 }
425 
426 CLI11_INLINE std::string &rtrim(std::string &str, const std::string &filter) {
427  auto it =
428  std::find_if(str.rbegin(), str.rend(), [&filter](char ch) { return filter.find(ch) == std::string::npos; });
429  str.erase(it.base(), str.end());
430  return str;
431 }
432 
433 CLI11_INLINE std::string &remove_quotes(std::string &str) {
434  if(str.length() > 1 && (str.front() == '"' || str.front() == '\'')) {
435  if(str.front() == str.back()) {
436  str.pop_back();
437  str.erase(str.begin(), str.begin() + 1);
438  }
439  }
440  return str;
441 }
442 
443 CLI11_INLINE std::string fix_newlines(const std::string &leader, std::string input) {
444  std::string::size_type n = 0;
445  while(n != std::string::npos && n < input.size()) {
446  n = input.find('\n', n);
447  if(n != std::string::npos) {
448  input = input.substr(0, n + 1) + leader + input.substr(n + 1);
449  n += leader.size();
450  }
451  }
452  return input;
453 }
454 
455 CLI11_INLINE std::ostream &
456 format_help(std::ostream &out, std::string name, const std::string &description, std::size_t wid) {
457  name = " " + name;
458  out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << std::left << name;
459  if(!description.empty()) {
460  if(name.length() >= wid)
461  out << "\n" << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
462  for(const char c : description) {
463  out.put(c);
464  if(c == '\n') {
465  out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << "";
466  }
467  }
468  }
469  out << "\n";
470  return out;
471 }
472 
473 CLI11_INLINE std::ostream &format_aliases(std::ostream &out, const std::vector<std::string> &aliases, std::size_t wid) {
474  if(!aliases.empty()) {
475  out << std::setw(static_cast<int>(wid)) << " aliases: ";
476  bool front = true;
477  for(const auto &alias : aliases) {
478  if(!front) {
479  out << ", ";
480  } else {
481  front = false;
482  }
483  out << detail::fix_newlines(" ", alias);
484  }
485  out << "\n";
486  }
487  return out;
488 }
489 
490 CLI11_INLINE bool valid_name_string(const std::string &str) {
491  if(str.empty() || !valid_first_char(str[0])) {
492  return false;
493  }
494  auto e = str.end();
495  for(auto c = str.begin() + 1; c != e; ++c)
496  if(!valid_later_char(*c))
497  return false;
498  return true;
499 }
500 
501 CLI11_INLINE std::string find_and_replace(std::string str, std::string from, std::string to) {
502 
503  std::size_t start_pos = 0;
504 
505  while((start_pos = str.find(from, start_pos)) != std::string::npos) {
506  str.replace(start_pos, from.length(), to);
507  start_pos += to.length();
508  }
509 
510  return str;
511 }
512 
513 CLI11_INLINE void remove_default_flag_values(std::string &flags) {
514  auto loc = flags.find_first_of('{', 2);
515  while(loc != std::string::npos) {
516  auto finish = flags.find_first_of("},", loc + 1);
517  if((finish != std::string::npos) && (flags[finish] == '}')) {
518  flags.erase(flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(loc),
519  flags.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(finish) + 1);
520  }
521  loc = flags.find_first_of('{', loc + 1);
522  }
523  flags.erase(std::remove(flags.begin(), flags.end(), '!'), flags.end());
524 }
525 
526 CLI11_INLINE std::ptrdiff_t
527 find_member(std::string name, const std::vector<std::string> names, bool ignore_case, bool ignore_underscore) {
528  auto it = std::end(names);
529  if(ignore_case) {
530  if(ignore_underscore) {
531  name = detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(name));
532  it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
533  return detail::to_lower(detail::remove_underscore(local_name)) == name;
534  });
535  } else {
536  name = detail::to_lower(name);
537  it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
538  return detail::to_lower(local_name) == name;
539  });
540  }
541 
542  } else if(ignore_underscore) {
543  name = detail::remove_underscore(name);
544  it = std::find_if(std::begin(names), std::end(names), [&name](std::string local_name) {
545  return detail::remove_underscore(local_name) == name;
546  });
547  } else {
548  it = std::find(std::begin(names), std::end(names), name);
549  }
550 
551  return (it != std::end(names)) ? (it - std::begin(names)) : (-1);
552 }
553 
554 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_up(std::string str, char delimiter) {
555 
556  const std::string delims("\'\"`");
557  auto find_ws = [delimiter](char ch) {
558  return (delimiter == '\0') ? std::isspace<char>(ch, std::locale()) : (ch == delimiter);
559  };
560  trim(str);
561 
562  std::vector<std::string> output;
563  bool embeddedQuote = false;
564  char keyChar = ' ';
565  while(!str.empty()) {
566  if(delims.find_first_of(str[0]) != std::string::npos) {
567  keyChar = str[0];
568  auto end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
569  while((end != std::string::npos) && (str[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
570  end = str.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
571  embeddedQuote = true;
572  }
573  if(end != std::string::npos) {
574  output.push_back(str.substr(1, end - 1));
575  if(end + 2 < str.size()) {
576  str = str.substr(end + 2);
577  } else {
578  str.clear();
579  }
580 
581  } else {
582  output.push_back(str.substr(1));
583  str = "";
584  }
585  } else {
586  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(str), std::end(str), find_ws);
587  if(it != std::end(str)) {
588  std::string value = std::string(str.begin(), it);
589  output.push_back(value);
590  str = std::string(it + 1, str.end());
591  } else {
592  output.push_back(str);
593  str = "";
594  }
595  }
596  // transform any embedded quotes into the regular character
597  if(embeddedQuote) {
598  output.back() = find_and_replace(output.back(), std::string("\\") + keyChar, std::string(1, keyChar));
599  embeddedQuote = false;
600  }
601  trim(str);
602  }
603  return output;
604 }
605 
606 CLI11_INLINE std::size_t escape_detect(std::string &str, std::size_t offset) {
607  auto next = str[offset + 1];
608  if((next == '\"') || (next == '\'') || (next == '`')) {
609  auto astart = str.find_last_of("-/ \"\'`", offset - 1);
610  if(astart != std::string::npos) {
611  if(str[astart] == ((str[offset] == '=') ? '-' : '/'))
612  str[offset] = ' '; // interpret this as a space so the split_up works properly
613  }
614  }
615  return offset + 1;
616 }
617 
618 CLI11_INLINE std::string &add_quotes_if_needed(std::string &str) {
619  if((str.front() != '"' && str.front() != '\'') || str.front() != str.back()) {
620  char quote = str.find('"') < str.find('\'') ? '\'' : '"';
621  if(str.find(' ') != std::string::npos) {
622  str.insert(0, 1, quote);
623  str.append(1, quote);
624  }
625  }
626  return str;
627 }
628 
629 } // namespace detail
630 
631 
632 
633 // Use one of these on all error classes.
634 // These are temporary and are undef'd at the end of this file.
635 #define CLI11_ERROR_DEF(parent, name) \
636  protected: \
637  name(std::string ename, std::string msg, int exit_code) : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
638  name(std::string ename, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) \
639  : parent(std::move(ename), std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
640  \
641  public: \
642  name(std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {} \
643  name(std::string msg, int exit_code) : parent(#name, std::move(msg), exit_code) {}
644 
645 // This is added after the one above if a class is used directly and builds its own message
646 #define CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(name) \
647  explicit name(std::string msg) : name(#name, msg, ExitCodes::name) {}
648 
651 enum class ExitCodes {
652  Success = 0,
653  IncorrectConstruction = 100,
654  BadNameString,
655  OptionAlreadyAdded,
656  FileError,
657  ConversionError,
658  ValidationError,
659  RequiredError,
660  RequiresError,
661  ExcludesError,
662  ExtrasError,
663  ConfigError,
664  InvalidError,
665  HorribleError,
666  OptionNotFound,
667  ArgumentMismatch,
668  BaseClass = 127
669 };
670 
671 // Error definitions
672 
678 
680 class Error : public std::runtime_error {
681  int actual_exit_code;
682  std::string error_name{"Error"};
683 
684  public:
685  CLI11_NODISCARD int get_exit_code() const { return actual_exit_code; }
686 
687  CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_name() const { return error_name; }
688 
689  Error(std::string name, std::string msg, int exit_code = static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::BaseClass))
690  : runtime_error(msg), actual_exit_code(exit_code), error_name(std::move(name)) {}
691 
692  Error(std::string name, std::string msg, ExitCodes exit_code) : Error(name, msg, static_cast<int>(exit_code)) {}
693 };
694 
695 // Note: Using Error::Error constructors does not work on GCC 4.7
696 
698 class ConstructionError : public Error {
699  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ConstructionError)
700 };
701 
703 class IncorrectConstruction : public ConstructionError {
704  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, IncorrectConstruction)
705  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(IncorrectConstruction)
706  static IncorrectConstruction PositionalFlag(std::string name) {
707  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Flags cannot be positional");
708  }
709  static IncorrectConstruction Set0Opt(std::string name) {
710  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set 0 expected, use a flag instead");
711  }
712  static IncorrectConstruction SetFlag(std::string name) {
713  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": Cannot set an expected number for flags");
714  }
715  static IncorrectConstruction ChangeNotVector(std::string name) {
716  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": You can only change the expected arguments for vectors");
717  }
718  static IncorrectConstruction AfterMultiOpt(std::string name) {
719  return IncorrectConstruction(
720  name + ": You can't change expected arguments after you've changed the multi option policy!");
721  }
722  static IncorrectConstruction MissingOption(std::string name) {
723  return IncorrectConstruction("Option " + name + " is not defined");
724  }
725  static IncorrectConstruction MultiOptionPolicy(std::string name) {
726  return IncorrectConstruction(name + ": multi_option_policy only works for flags and exact value options");
727  }
728 };
729 
731 class BadNameString : public ConstructionError {
732  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, BadNameString)
733  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(BadNameString)
734  static BadNameString OneCharName(std::string name) { return BadNameString("Invalid one char name: " + name); }
735  static BadNameString BadLongName(std::string name) { return BadNameString("Bad long name: " + name); }
736  static BadNameString DashesOnly(std::string name) {
737  return BadNameString("Must have a name, not just dashes: " + name);
738  }
739  static BadNameString MultiPositionalNames(std::string name) {
740  return BadNameString("Only one positional name allowed, remove: " + name);
741  }
742 };
743 
745 class OptionAlreadyAdded : public ConstructionError {
746  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ConstructionError, OptionAlreadyAdded)
747  explicit OptionAlreadyAdded(std::string name)
748  : OptionAlreadyAdded(name + " is already added", ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded) {}
749  static OptionAlreadyAdded Requires(std::string name, std::string other) {
750  return {name + " requires " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded};
751  }
752  static OptionAlreadyAdded Excludes(std::string name, std::string other) {
753  return {name + " excludes " + other, ExitCodes::OptionAlreadyAdded};
754  }
755 };
756 
757 // Parsing errors
758 
760 class ParseError : public Error {
761  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, ParseError)
762 };
763 
764 // Not really "errors"
765 
767 class Success : public ParseError {
768  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, Success)
769  Success() : Success("Successfully completed, should be caught and quit", ExitCodes::Success) {}
770 };
771 
773 class CallForHelp : public Success {
774  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForHelp)
775  CallForHelp() : CallForHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {}
776 };
777 
779 class CallForAllHelp : public Success {
780  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForAllHelp)
781  CallForAllHelp()
782  : CallForAllHelp("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {}
783 };
784 
786 class CallForVersion : public Success {
787  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Success, CallForVersion)
788  CallForVersion()
789  : CallForVersion("This should be caught in your main function, see examples", ExitCodes::Success) {}
790 };
791 
793 class RuntimeError : public ParseError {
794  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RuntimeError)
795  explicit RuntimeError(int exit_code = 1) : RuntimeError("Runtime error", exit_code) {}
796 };
797 
799 class FileError : public ParseError {
800  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, FileError)
801  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(FileError)
802  static FileError Missing(std::string name) { return FileError(name + " was not readable (missing?)"); }
803 };
804 
806 class ConversionError : public ParseError {
807  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConversionError)
808  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConversionError)
809  ConversionError(std::string member, std::string name)
810  : ConversionError("The value " + member + " is not an allowed value for " + name) {}
811  ConversionError(std::string name, std::vector<std::string> results)
812  : ConversionError("Could not convert: " + name + " = " + detail::join(results)) {}
813  static ConversionError TooManyInputsFlag(std::string name) {
814  return ConversionError(name + ": too many inputs for a flag");
815  }
816  static ConversionError TrueFalse(std::string name) {
817  return ConversionError(name + ": Should be true/false or a number");
818  }
819 };
820 
822 class ValidationError : public ParseError {
823  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ValidationError)
824  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ValidationError)
825  explicit ValidationError(std::string name, std::string msg) : ValidationError(name + ": " + msg) {}
826 };
827 
829 class RequiredError : public ParseError {
830  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiredError)
831  explicit RequiredError(std::string name) : RequiredError(name + " is required", ExitCodes::RequiredError) {}
832  static RequiredError Subcommand(std::size_t min_subcom) {
833  if(min_subcom == 1) {
834  return RequiredError("A subcommand");
835  }
836  return {"Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_subcom) + " subcommands", ExitCodes::RequiredError};
837  }
838  static RequiredError
839  Option(std::size_t min_option, std::size_t max_option, std::size_t used, const std::string &option_list) {
840  if((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used == 0))
841  return RequiredError("Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
842  if((min_option == 1) && (max_option == 1) && (used > 1)) {
843  return {"Exactly 1 option from [" + option_list + "] is required and " + std::to_string(used) +
844  " were given",
845  ExitCodes::RequiredError};
846  }
847  if((min_option == 1) && (used == 0))
848  return RequiredError("At least 1 option from [" + option_list + "]");
849  if(used < min_option) {
850  return {"Requires at least " + std::to_string(min_option) + " options used and only " +
851  std::to_string(used) + "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
852  ExitCodes::RequiredError};
853  }
854  if(max_option == 1)
855  return {"Requires at most 1 options be given from [" + option_list + "]", ExitCodes::RequiredError};
856 
857  return {"Requires at most " + std::to_string(max_option) + " options be used and " + std::to_string(used) +
858  "were given from [" + option_list + "]",
859  ExitCodes::RequiredError};
860  }
861 };
862 
864 class ArgumentMismatch : public ParseError {
865  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ArgumentMismatch)
866  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ArgumentMismatch)
867  ArgumentMismatch(std::string name, int expected, std::size_t received)
868  : ArgumentMismatch(expected > 0 ? ("Expected exactly " + std::to_string(expected) + " arguments to " + name +
869  ", got " + std::to_string(received))
870  : ("Expected at least " + std::to_string(-expected) + " arguments to " + name +
871  ", got " + std::to_string(received)),
872  ExitCodes::ArgumentMismatch) {}
873 
874  static ArgumentMismatch AtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
875  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At least " + std::to_string(num) + " required but received " +
876  std::to_string(received));
877  }
878  static ArgumentMismatch AtMost(std::string name, int num, std::size_t received) {
879  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": At Most " + std::to_string(num) + " required but received " +
880  std::to_string(received));
881  }
882  static ArgumentMismatch TypedAtLeast(std::string name, int num, std::string type) {
883  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + std::to_string(num) + " required " + type + " missing");
884  }
885  static ArgumentMismatch FlagOverride(std::string name) {
886  return ArgumentMismatch(name + " was given a disallowed flag override");
887  }
888  static ArgumentMismatch PartialType(std::string name, int num, std::string type) {
889  return ArgumentMismatch(name + ": " + type + " only partially specified: " + std::to_string(num) +
890  " required for each element");
891  }
892 };
893 
895 class RequiresError : public ParseError {
896  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, RequiresError)
897  RequiresError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
898  : RequiresError(curname + " requires " + subname, ExitCodes::RequiresError) {}
899 };
900 
902 class ExcludesError : public ParseError {
903  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExcludesError)
904  ExcludesError(std::string curname, std::string subname)
905  : ExcludesError(curname + " excludes " + subname, ExitCodes::ExcludesError) {}
906 };
907 
909 class ExtrasError : public ParseError {
910  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ExtrasError)
911  explicit ExtrasError(std::vector<std::string> args)
912  : ExtrasError((args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
913  : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
914  detail::rjoin(args, " "),
915  ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
916  ExtrasError(const std::string &name, std::vector<std::string> args)
917  : ExtrasError(name,
918  (args.size() > 1 ? "The following arguments were not expected: "
919  : "The following argument was not expected: ") +
920  detail::rjoin(args, " "),
921  ExitCodes::ExtrasError) {}
922 };
923 
925 class ConfigError : public ParseError {
926  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, ConfigError)
927  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(ConfigError)
928  static ConfigError Extras(std::string item) { return ConfigError("INI was not able to parse " + item); }
929  static ConfigError NotConfigurable(std::string item) {
930  return ConfigError(item + ": This option is not allowed in a configuration file");
931  }
932 };
933 
935 class InvalidError : public ParseError {
936  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, InvalidError)
937  explicit InvalidError(std::string name)
938  : InvalidError(name + ": Too many positional arguments with unlimited expected args", ExitCodes::InvalidError) {
939  }
940 };
941 
944 class HorribleError : public ParseError {
945  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(ParseError, HorribleError)
946  CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE(HorribleError)
947 };
948 
949 // After parsing
950 
952 class OptionNotFound : public Error {
953  CLI11_ERROR_DEF(Error, OptionNotFound)
954  explicit OptionNotFound(std::string name) : OptionNotFound(name + " not found", ExitCodes::OptionNotFound) {}
955 };
956 
957 #undef CLI11_ERROR_DEF
958 #undef CLI11_ERROR_SIMPLE
959 
961 
962 
963 
964 
965 // Type tools
966 
967 // Utilities for type enabling
968 namespace detail {
969 // Based generally on https://rmf.io/cxx11/almost-static-if
971 enum class enabler {};
972 
974 constexpr enabler dummy = {};
975 } // namespace detail
976 
982 template <bool B, class T = void> using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
983 
985 template <typename... Ts> struct make_void { using type = void; };
986 
988 template <typename... Ts> using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;
989 
991 template <bool B, class T, class F> using conditional_t = typename std::conditional<B, T, F>::type;
992 
994 template <typename T> struct is_bool : std::false_type {};
995 
997 template <> struct is_bool<bool> : std::true_type {};
998 
1000 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr : std::false_type {};
1001 
1003 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr<std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
1004 
1006 template <typename T> struct is_shared_ptr<const std::shared_ptr<T>> : std::true_type {};
1007 
1009 template <typename T> struct is_copyable_ptr {
1010  static bool const value = is_shared_ptr<T>::value || std::is_pointer<T>::value;
1011 };
1012 
1014 template <typename T> struct IsMemberType { using type = T; };
1015 
1017 template <> struct IsMemberType<const char *> { using type = std::string; };
1018 
1019 namespace detail {
1020 
1021 // These are utilities for IsMember and other transforming objects
1022 
1025 
1027 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct element_type { using type = T; };
1028 
1029 template <typename T> struct element_type<T, typename std::enable_if<is_copyable_ptr<T>::value>::type> {
1030  using type = typename std::pointer_traits<T>::element_type;
1031 };
1032 
1035 template <typename T> struct element_value_type { using type = typename element_type<T>::type::value_type; };
1036 
1038 template <typename T, typename _ = void> struct pair_adaptor : std::false_type {
1039  using value_type = typename T::value_type;
1040  using first_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
1041  using second_type = typename std::remove_const<value_type>::type;
1042 
1044  template <typename Q> static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
1045  return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
1046  }
1048  template <typename Q> static auto second(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::forward<Q>(pair_value)) {
1049  return std::forward<Q>(pair_value);
1050  }
1051 };
1052 
1055 template <typename T>
1056 struct pair_adaptor<
1057  T,
1058  conditional_t<false, void_t<typename T::value_type::first_type, typename T::value_type::second_type>, void>>
1059  : std::true_type {
1060  using value_type = typename T::value_type;
1061  using first_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::first_type>::type;
1062  using second_type = typename std::remove_const<typename value_type::second_type>::type;
1063 
1065  template <typename Q> static auto first(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
1066  return std::get<0>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
1067  }
1069  template <typename Q> static auto second(Q &&pair_value) -> decltype(std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value))) {
1070  return std::get<1>(std::forward<Q>(pair_value));
1071  }
1072 };
1073 
1074 // Warning is suppressed due to "bug" in gcc<5.0 and gcc 7.0 with c++17 enabled that generates a Wnarrowing warning
1075 // in the unevaluated context even if the function that was using this wasn't used. The standard says narrowing in
1076 // brace initialization shouldn't be allowed but for backwards compatibility gcc allows it in some contexts. It is a
1077 // little fuzzy what happens in template constructs and I think that was something GCC took a little while to work out.
1078 // But regardless some versions of gcc generate a warning when they shouldn't from the following code so that should be
1079 // suppressed
1080 #ifdef __GNUC__
1081 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
1082 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnarrowing"
1083 #endif
1084 // check for constructibility from a specific type and copy assignable used in the parse detection
1085 template <typename T, typename C> class is_direct_constructible {
1086  template <typename TT, typename CC>
1087  static auto test(int, std::true_type) -> decltype(
1088 // NVCC warns about narrowing conversions here
1089 #ifdef __CUDACC__
1090 #pragma diag_suppress 2361
1091 #endif
1092  TT{std::declval<CC>()}
1093 #ifdef __CUDACC__
1094 #pragma diag_default 2361
1095 #endif
1096  ,
1097  std::is_move_assignable<TT>());
1098 
1099  template <typename TT, typename CC> static auto test(int, std::false_type) -> std::false_type;
1100 
1101  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1102 
1103  public:
1104  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, C>(0, typename std::is_constructible<T, C>::type()))::value;
1105 };
1106 #ifdef __GNUC__
1107 #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
1108 #endif
1109 
1110 // Check for output streamability
1111 // Based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22758291/how-can-i-detect-if-a-type-can-be-streamed-to-an-stdostream
1112 
1113 template <typename T, typename S = std::ostringstream> class is_ostreamable {
1114  template <typename TT, typename SS>
1115  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() << std::declval<TT>(), std::true_type());
1116 
1117  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1118 
1119  public:
1120  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1121 };
1122 
1124 template <typename T, typename S = std::istringstream> class is_istreamable {
1125  template <typename TT, typename SS>
1126  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<SS &>() >> std::declval<TT &>(), std::true_type());
1127 
1128  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1129 
1130  public:
1131  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T, S>(0))::value;
1132 };
1133 
1135 template <typename T> class is_complex {
1136  template <typename TT>
1137  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<TT>().real(), std::declval<TT>().imag(), std::true_type());
1138 
1139  template <typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1140 
1141  public:
1142  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<T>(0))::value;
1143 };
1144 
1146 template <typename T, enable_if_t<is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1147 bool from_stream(const std::string &istring, T &obj) {
1148  std::istringstream is;
1149  is.str(istring);
1150  is >> obj;
1151  return !is.fail() && !is.rdbuf()->in_avail();
1152 }
1153 
1154 template <typename T, enable_if_t<!is_istreamable<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1155 bool from_stream(const std::string & /*istring*/, T & /*obj*/) {
1156  return false;
1157 }
1158 
1159 // check to see if an object is a mutable container (fail by default)
1160 template <typename T, typename _ = void> struct is_mutable_container : std::false_type {};
1161 
1165 template <typename T>
1166 struct is_mutable_container<
1167  T,
1168  conditional_t<false,
1169  void_t<typename T::value_type,
1170  decltype(std::declval<T>().end()),
1171  decltype(std::declval<T>().clear()),
1172  decltype(std::declval<T>().insert(std::declval<decltype(std::declval<T>().end())>(),
1173  std::declval<const typename T::value_type &>()))>,
1174  void>>
1175  : public conditional_t<std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value, std::false_type, std::true_type> {};
1176 
1177 // check to see if an object is a mutable container (fail by default)
1178 template <typename T, typename _ = void> struct is_readable_container : std::false_type {};
1179 
1183 template <typename T>
1184 struct is_readable_container<
1185  T,
1186  conditional_t<false, void_t<decltype(std::declval<T>().end()), decltype(std::declval<T>().begin())>, void>>
1187  : public std::true_type {};
1188 
1189 // check to see if an object is a wrapper (fail by default)
1190 template <typename T, typename _ = void> struct is_wrapper : std::false_type {};
1191 
1192 // check if an object is a wrapper (it has a value_type defined)
1193 template <typename T>
1194 struct is_wrapper<T, conditional_t<false, void_t<typename T::value_type>, void>> : public std::true_type {};
1195 
1196 // Check for tuple like types, as in classes with a tuple_size type trait
1197 template <typename S> class is_tuple_like {
1198  template <typename SS>
1199  // static auto test(int)
1200  // -> decltype(std::conditional<(std::tuple_size<SS>::value > 0), std::true_type, std::false_type>::type());
1201  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::tuple_size<typename std::decay<SS>::type>::value, std::true_type{});
1202  template <typename> static auto test(...) -> std::false_type;
1203 
1204  public:
1205  static constexpr bool value = decltype(test<S>(0))::value;
1206 };
1207 
1209 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1210 auto to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(std::forward<T>(value)) {
1211  return std::forward<T>(value);
1212 }
1213 
1215 template <typename T,
1216  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value,
1217  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1218 std::string to_string(const T &value) {
1219  return std::string(value); // NOLINT(google-readability-casting)
1220 }
1221 
1223 template <typename T,
1224  enable_if_t<!std::is_convertible<std::string, T>::value && !std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value &&
1225  is_ostreamable<T>::value,
1226  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1227 std::string to_string(T &&value) {
1228  std::stringstream stream;
1229  stream << value;
1230  return stream.str();
1231 }
1232 
1234 template <typename T,
1235  enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1236  !is_readable_container<typename std::remove_const<T>::type>::value,
1237  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1238 std::string to_string(T &&) {
1239  return {};
1240 }
1241 
1243 template <typename T,
1244  enable_if_t<!std::is_constructible<std::string, T>::value && !is_ostreamable<T>::value &&
1245  is_readable_container<T>::value,
1246  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1247 std::string to_string(T &&variable) {
1248  auto cval = variable.begin();
1249  auto end = variable.end();
1250  if(cval == end) {
1251  return {"{}"};
1252  }
1253  std::vector<std::string> defaults;
1254  while(cval != end) {
1255  defaults.emplace_back(CLI::detail::to_string(*cval));
1256  ++cval;
1257  }
1258  return {"[" + detail::join(defaults) + "]"};
1259 }
1260 
1262 template <typename T1,
1263  typename T2,
1264  typename T,
1265  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1266 auto checked_to_string(T &&value) -> decltype(to_string(std::forward<T>(value))) {
1267  return to_string(std::forward<T>(value));
1268 }
1269 
1271 template <typename T1,
1272  typename T2,
1273  typename T,
1274  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<T1, T2>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1275 std::string checked_to_string(T &&) {
1276  return std::string{};
1277 }
1279 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1280 std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1281  return std::to_string(value);
1282 }
1284 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_enum<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1285 std::string value_string(const T &value) {
1286  return std::to_string(static_cast<typename std::underlying_type<T>::type>(value));
1287 }
1289 template <typename T,
1290  enable_if_t<!std::is_enum<T>::value && !std::is_arithmetic<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1291 auto value_string(const T &value) -> decltype(to_string(value)) {
1292  return to_string(value);
1293 }
1294 
1296 template <typename T, typename def, typename Enable = void> struct wrapped_type { using type = def; };
1297 
1299 template <typename T, typename def> struct wrapped_type<T, def, typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value>::type> {
1300  using type = typename T::value_type;
1301 };
1302 
1304 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct type_count_base { static const int value{0}; };
1305 
1307 template <typename T>
1308 struct type_count_base<T,
1309  typename std::enable_if<!is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value &&
1310  !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1311  static constexpr int value{1};
1312 };
1313 
1315 template <typename T>
1316 struct type_count_base<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1317  static constexpr int value{std::tuple_size<T>::value};
1318 };
1319 
1321 template <typename T> struct type_count_base<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1322  static constexpr int value{type_count_base<typename T::value_type>::value};
1323 };
1324 
1326 
1328 template <typename T> struct subtype_count;
1329 
1331 template <typename T> struct subtype_count_min;
1332 
1334 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct type_count { static const int value{0}; };
1335 
1337 template <typename T>
1338 struct type_count<T,
1339  typename std::enable_if<!is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1340  !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1341  static constexpr int value{1};
1342 };
1343 
1345 template <typename T> struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1346  static constexpr int value{2};
1347 };
1348 
1350 template <typename T> struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1351  static constexpr int value{subtype_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1352 };
1353 
1355 template <typename T>
1356 struct type_count<T,
1357  typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1358  !is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1359  static constexpr int value{type_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1360 };
1361 
1363 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1364 constexpr typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size() {
1365  return 0;
1366 }
1367 
1369 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1370  constexpr typename std::enable_if < I<type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size() {
1371  return subtype_count<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::value + tuple_type_size<T, I + 1>();
1372 }
1373 
1375 template <typename T> struct type_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1376  static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size<T, 0>()};
1377 };
1378 
1380 template <typename T> struct subtype_count {
1381  static constexpr int value{is_mutable_container<T>::value ? expected_max_vector_size : type_count<T>::value};
1382 };
1383 
1385 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct type_count_min { static const int value{0}; };
1386 
1388 template <typename T>
1389 struct type_count_min<
1390  T,
1391  typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value && !is_wrapper<T>::value &&
1392  !is_complex<T>::value && !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1393  static constexpr int value{type_count<T>::value};
1394 };
1395 
1397 template <typename T> struct type_count_min<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1398  static constexpr int value{1};
1399 };
1400 
1402 template <typename T>
1403 struct type_count_min<
1404  T,
1405  typename std::enable_if<is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_complex<T>::value && !is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1406  static constexpr int value{subtype_count_min<typename T::value_type>::value};
1407 };
1408 
1410 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1411 constexpr typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size_min() {
1412  return 0;
1413 }
1414 
1416 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1417  constexpr typename std::enable_if < I<type_count_base<T>::value, int>::type tuple_type_size_min() {
1418  return subtype_count_min<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::value + tuple_type_size_min<T, I + 1>();
1419 }
1420 
1422 template <typename T> struct type_count_min<T, typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value>::type> {
1423  static constexpr int value{tuple_type_size_min<T, 0>()};
1424 };
1425 
1427 template <typename T> struct subtype_count_min {
1428  static constexpr int value{is_mutable_container<T>::value
1429  ? ((type_count<T>::value < expected_max_vector_size) ? type_count<T>::value : 0)
1430  : type_count_min<T>::value};
1431 };
1432 
1434 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct expected_count { static const int value{0}; };
1435 
1437 template <typename T>
1438 struct expected_count<T,
1439  typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && !is_wrapper<T>::value &&
1440  !std::is_void<T>::value>::type> {
1441  static constexpr int value{1};
1442 };
1444 template <typename T> struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1445  static constexpr int value{expected_max_vector_size};
1446 };
1447 
1449 template <typename T>
1450 struct expected_count<T, typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<T>::value && is_wrapper<T>::value>::type> {
1451  static constexpr int value{expected_count<typename T::value_type>::value};
1452 };
1453 
1454 // Enumeration of the different supported categorizations of objects
1455 enum class object_category : int {
1456  char_value = 1,
1457  integral_value = 2,
1458  unsigned_integral = 4,
1459  enumeration = 6,
1460  boolean_value = 8,
1461  floating_point = 10,
1462  number_constructible = 12,
1463  double_constructible = 14,
1464  integer_constructible = 16,
1465  // string like types
1466  string_assignable = 23,
1467  string_constructible = 24,
1468  other = 45,
1469  // special wrapper or container types
1470  wrapper_value = 50,
1471  complex_number = 60,
1472  tuple_value = 70,
1473  container_value = 80,
1474 
1475 };
1476 
1478 
1480 template <typename T, typename Enable = void> struct classify_object {
1481  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::other};
1482 };
1483 
1485 template <typename T>
1486 struct classify_object<
1487  T,
1488  typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && !std::is_same<T, char>::value && std::is_signed<T>::value &&
1489  !is_bool<T>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1490  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integral_value};
1491 };
1492 
1494 template <typename T>
1495 struct classify_object<T,
1496  typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_unsigned<T>::value &&
1497  !std::is_same<T, char>::value && !is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1498  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::unsigned_integral};
1499 };
1500 
1502 template <typename T>
1503 struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<T, char>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1504  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::char_value};
1505 };
1506 
1508 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_bool<T>::value>::type> {
1509  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::boolean_value};
1510 };
1511 
1513 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value>::type> {
1514  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::floating_point};
1515 };
1516 
1518 template <typename T>
1519 struct classify_object<T,
1520  typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1521  std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value>::type> {
1522  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_assignable};
1523 };
1524 
1526 template <typename T>
1527 struct classify_object<
1528  T,
1529  typename std::enable_if<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1530  !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value && (type_count<T>::value == 1) &&
1531  std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value>::type> {
1532  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::string_constructible};
1533 };
1534 
1536 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_enum<T>::value>::type> {
1537  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::enumeration};
1538 };
1539 
1540 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_complex<T>::value>::type> {
1541  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::complex_number};
1542 };
1543 
1546 template <typename T> struct uncommon_type {
1547  using type = typename std::conditional<!std::is_floating_point<T>::value && !std::is_integral<T>::value &&
1548  !std::is_assignable<T &, std::string>::value &&
1549  !std::is_constructible<T, std::string>::value && !is_complex<T>::value &&
1550  !is_mutable_container<T>::value && !std::is_enum<T>::value,
1551  std::true_type,
1552  std::false_type>::type;
1553  static constexpr bool value = type::value;
1554 };
1555 
1557 template <typename T>
1558 struct classify_object<T,
1559  typename std::enable_if<(!is_mutable_container<T>::value && is_wrapper<T>::value &&
1560  !is_tuple_like<T>::value && uncommon_type<T>::value)>::type> {
1561  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::wrapper_value};
1562 };
1563 
1565 template <typename T>
1566 struct classify_object<T,
1567  typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1568  !is_wrapper<T>::value && is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1569  is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1570  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::number_constructible};
1571 };
1572 
1574 template <typename T>
1575 struct classify_object<T,
1576  typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1577  !is_wrapper<T>::value && !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1578  is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1579  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::integer_constructible};
1580 };
1581 
1583 template <typename T>
1584 struct classify_object<T,
1585  typename std::enable_if<uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value == 1 &&
1586  !is_wrapper<T>::value && is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1587  !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value>::type> {
1588  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::double_constructible};
1589 };
1590 
1592 template <typename T>
1593 struct classify_object<
1594  T,
1595  typename std::enable_if<is_tuple_like<T>::value &&
1596  ((type_count<T>::value >= 2 && !is_wrapper<T>::value) ||
1597  (uncommon_type<T>::value && !is_direct_constructible<T, double>::value &&
1598  !is_direct_constructible<T, int>::value) ||
1599  (uncommon_type<T>::value && type_count<T>::value >= 2))>::type> {
1600  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::tuple_value};
1601  // the condition on this class requires it be like a tuple, but on some compilers (like Xcode) tuples can be
1602  // constructed from just the first element so tuples of <string, int,int> can be constructed from a string, which
1603  // could lead to issues so there are two variants of the condition, the first isolates things with a type size >=2
1604  // mainly to get tuples on Xcode with the exception of wrappers, the second is the main one and just separating out
1605  // those cases that are caught by other object classifications
1606 };
1607 
1609 template <typename T> struct classify_object<T, typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<T>::value>::type> {
1610  static constexpr object_category value{object_category::container_value};
1611 };
1612 
1613 // Type name print
1614 
1618 
1619 template <typename T,
1620  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::char_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1621 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1622  return "CHAR";
1623 }
1624 
1625 template <typename T,
1626  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value ||
1627  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible,
1628  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1629 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1630  return "INT";
1631 }
1632 
1633 template <typename T,
1634  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1635 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1636  return "UINT";
1637 }
1638 
1639 template <typename T,
1640  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point ||
1641  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible ||
1642  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible,
1643  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1644 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1645  return "FLOAT";
1646 }
1647 
1649 template <typename T,
1650  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1651 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1652  return "ENUM";
1653 }
1654 
1656 template <typename T,
1657  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1658 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1659  return "BOOLEAN";
1660 }
1661 
1663 template <typename T,
1664  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::complex_number, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1665 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1666  return "COMPLEX";
1667 }
1668 
1670 template <typename T,
1671  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value >= object_category::string_assignable &&
1672  classify_object<T>::value <= object_category::other,
1673  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1674 constexpr const char *type_name() {
1675  return "TEXT";
1676 }
1678 template <typename T,
1679  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value && type_count_base<T>::value >= 2,
1680  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1681 std::string type_name(); // forward declaration
1682 
1684 template <typename T,
1685  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::container_value ||
1686  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value,
1687  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1688 std::string type_name(); // forward declaration
1689 
1691 template <typename T,
1692  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value && type_count_base<T>::value == 1,
1693  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1694 inline std::string type_name() {
1695  return type_name<typename std::decay<typename std::tuple_element<0, T>::type>::type>();
1696 }
1697 
1699 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1700 inline typename std::enable_if<I == type_count_base<T>::value, std::string>::type tuple_name() {
1701  return std::string{};
1702 }
1703 
1705 template <typename T, std::size_t I>
1706 inline typename std::enable_if<(I < type_count_base<T>::value), std::string>::type tuple_name() {
1707  auto str = std::string{type_name<typename std::decay<typename std::tuple_element<I, T>::type>::type>()} + ',' +
1708  tuple_name<T, I + 1>();
1709  if(str.back() == ',')
1710  str.pop_back();
1711  return str;
1712 }
1713 
1715 template <typename T,
1716  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::tuple_value && type_count_base<T>::value >= 2,
1717  detail::enabler>>
1718 inline std::string type_name() {
1719  auto tname = std::string(1, '[') + tuple_name<T, 0>();
1720  tname.push_back(']');
1721  return tname;
1722 }
1723 
1725 template <typename T,
1726  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::container_value ||
1727  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value,
1728  detail::enabler>>
1729 inline std::string type_name() {
1730  return type_name<typename T::value_type>();
1731 }
1732 
1733 // Lexical cast
1734 
1736 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_unsigned<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1737 bool integral_conversion(const std::string &input, T &output) noexcept {
1738  if(input.empty()) {
1739  return false;
1740  }
1741  char *val = nullptr;
1742  std::uint64_t output_ll = std::strtoull(input.c_str(), &val, 0);
1743  output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1744  if(val == (input.c_str() + input.size()) && static_cast<std::uint64_t>(output) == output_ll) {
1745  return true;
1746  }
1747  val = nullptr;
1748  std::int64_t output_sll = std::strtoll(input.c_str(), &val, 0);
1749  if(val == (input.c_str() + input.size())) {
1750  output = (output_sll < 0) ? static_cast<T>(0) : static_cast<T>(output_sll);
1751  return (static_cast<std::int64_t>(output) == output_sll);
1752  }
1753  return false;
1754 }
1755 
1757 template <typename T, enable_if_t<std::is_signed<T>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1758 bool integral_conversion(const std::string &input, T &output) noexcept {
1759  if(input.empty()) {
1760  return false;
1761  }
1762  char *val = nullptr;
1763  std::int64_t output_ll = std::strtoll(input.c_str(), &val, 0);
1764  output = static_cast<T>(output_ll);
1765  if(val == (input.c_str() + input.size()) && static_cast<std::int64_t>(output) == output_ll) {
1766  return true;
1767  }
1768  if(input == "true") {
1769  // this is to deal with a few oddities with flags and wrapper int types
1770  output = static_cast<T>(1);
1771  return true;
1772  }
1773  return false;
1774 }
1775 
1777 inline std::int64_t to_flag_value(std::string val) {
1778  static const std::string trueString("true");
1779  static const std::string falseString("false");
1780  if(val == trueString) {
1781  return 1;
1782  }
1783  if(val == falseString) {
1784  return -1;
1785  }
1786  val = detail::to_lower(val);
1787  std::int64_t ret = 0;
1788  if(val.size() == 1) {
1789  if(val[0] >= '1' && val[0] <= '9') {
1790  return (static_cast<std::int64_t>(val[0]) - '0');
1791  }
1792  switch(val[0]) {
1793  case '0':
1794  case 'f':
1795  case 'n':
1796  case '-':
1797  ret = -1;
1798  break;
1799  case 't':
1800  case 'y':
1801  case '+':
1802  ret = 1;
1803  break;
1804  default:
1805  throw std::invalid_argument("unrecognized character");
1806  }
1807  return ret;
1808  }
1809  if(val == trueString || val == "on" || val == "yes" || val == "enable") {
1810  ret = 1;
1811  } else if(val == falseString || val == "off" || val == "no" || val == "disable") {
1812  ret = -1;
1813  } else {
1814  ret = std::stoll(val);
1815  }
1816  return ret;
1817 }
1818 
1820 template <typename T,
1821  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integral_value ||
1822  classify_object<T>::value == object_category::unsigned_integral,
1823  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1824 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1825  return integral_conversion(input, output);
1826 }
1827 
1829 template <typename T,
1830  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::char_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1831 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1832  if(input.size() == 1) {
1833  output = static_cast<T>(input[0]);
1834  return true;
1835  }
1836  return integral_conversion(input, output);
1837 }
1838 
1840 template <typename T,
1841  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::boolean_value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1842 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1843  try {
1844  auto out = to_flag_value(input);
1845  output = (out > 0);
1846  return true;
1847  } catch(const std::invalid_argument &) {
1848  return false;
1849  } catch(const std::out_of_range &) {
1850  // if the number is out of the range of a 64 bit value then it is still a number and for this purpose is still
1851  // valid all we care about the sign
1852  output = (input[0] != '-');
1853  return true;
1854  }
1855 }
1856 
1858 template <typename T,
1859  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::floating_point, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1860 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1861  if(input.empty()) {
1862  return false;
1863  }
1864  char *val = nullptr;
1865  auto output_ld = std::strtold(input.c_str(), &val);
1866  output = static_cast<T>(output_ld);
1867  return val == (input.c_str() + input.size());
1868 }
1869 
1871 template <typename T,
1872  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::complex_number, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1873 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1874  using XC = typename wrapped_type<T, double>::type;
1875  XC x{0.0}, y{0.0};
1876  auto str1 = input;
1877  bool worked = false;
1878  auto nloc = str1.find_last_of("+-");
1879  if(nloc != std::string::npos && nloc > 0) {
1880  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1.substr(0, nloc), x);
1881  str1 = str1.substr(nloc);
1882  if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j')
1883  str1.pop_back();
1884  worked = worked && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
1885  } else {
1886  if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') {
1887  str1.pop_back();
1888  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
1889  x = XC{0};
1890  } else {
1891  worked = detail::lexical_cast(str1, x);
1892  y = XC{0};
1893  }
1894  }
1895  if(worked) {
1896  output = T{x, y};
1897  return worked;
1898  }
1899  return from_stream(input, output);
1900 }
1901 
1903 template <typename T,
1904  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_assignable, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1905 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1906  output = input;
1907  return true;
1908 }
1909 
1911 template <
1912  typename T,
1913  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::string_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1914 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1915  output = T(input);
1916  return true;
1917 }
1918 
1920 template <typename T,
1921  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::enumeration, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1922 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1923  typename std::underlying_type<T>::type val;
1924  if(!integral_conversion(input, val)) {
1925  return false;
1926  }
1927  output = static_cast<T>(val);
1928  return true;
1929 }
1930 
1932 template <typename T,
1933  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
1934  std::is_assignable<T &, typename T::value_type>::value,
1935  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1936 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1937  typename T::value_type val;
1938  if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1939  output = val;
1940  return true;
1941  }
1942  return from_stream(input, output);
1943 }
1944 
1945 template <typename T,
1946  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
1947  !std::is_assignable<T &, typename T::value_type>::value && std::is_assignable<T &, T>::value,
1948  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1949 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1950  typename T::value_type val;
1951  if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1952  output = T{val};
1953  return true;
1954  }
1955  return from_stream(input, output);
1956 }
1957 
1959 template <
1960  typename T,
1961  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::number_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1962 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1963  int val = 0;
1964  if(integral_conversion(input, val)) {
1965  output = T(val);
1966  return true;
1967  }
1968 
1969  double dval = 0.0;
1970  if(lexical_cast(input, dval)) {
1971  output = T{dval};
1972  return true;
1973  }
1974 
1975  return from_stream(input, output);
1976 }
1977 
1979 template <
1980  typename T,
1981  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::integer_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1982 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1983  int val = 0;
1984  if(integral_conversion(input, val)) {
1985  output = T(val);
1986  return true;
1987  }
1988  return from_stream(input, output);
1989 }
1990 
1992 template <
1993  typename T,
1994  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::double_constructible, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
1995 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
1996  double val = 0.0;
1997  if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
1998  output = T{val};
1999  return true;
2000  }
2001  return from_stream(input, output);
2002 }
2003 
2005 template <typename T,
2006  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::other && std::is_assignable<T &, int>::value,
2007  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2008 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2009  int val = 0;
2010  if(integral_conversion(input, val)) {
2011 #ifdef _MSC_VER
2012 #pragma warning(push)
2013 #pragma warning(disable : 4800)
2014 #endif
2015  // with Atomic<XX> this could produce a warning due to the conversion but if atomic gets here it is an old style
2016  // so will most likely still work
2017  output = val;
2018 #ifdef _MSC_VER
2019 #pragma warning(pop)
2020 #endif
2021  return true;
2022  }
2023  // LCOV_EXCL_START
2024  // This version of cast is only used for odd cases in an older compilers the fail over
2025  // from_stream is tested elsewhere an not relevant for coverage here
2026  return from_stream(input, output);
2027  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
2028 }
2029 
2031 template <typename T,
2032  enable_if_t<classify_object<T>::value == object_category::other && !std::is_assignable<T &, int>::value,
2033  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2034 bool lexical_cast(const std::string &input, T &output) {
2035  static_assert(is_istreamable<T>::value,
2036  "option object type must have a lexical cast overload or streaming input operator(>>) defined, if it "
2037  "is convertible from another type use the add_option<T, XC>(...) with XC being the known type");
2038  return from_stream(input, output);
2039 }
2040 
2043 template <typename AssignTo,
2044  typename ConvertTo,
2045  enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value &&
2046  (classify_object<AssignTo>::value == object_category::string_assignable ||
2047  classify_object<AssignTo>::value == object_category::string_constructible),
2048  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2049 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2050  return lexical_cast(input, output);
2051 }
2052 
2054 template <typename AssignTo,
2055  typename ConvertTo,
2056  enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value && std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2057  classify_object<AssignTo>::value != object_category::string_assignable &&
2058  classify_object<AssignTo>::value != object_category::string_constructible,
2059  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2060 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2061  if(input.empty()) {
2062  output = AssignTo{};
2063  return true;
2064  }
2065 
2066  return lexical_cast(input, output);
2067 }
2068 
2070 template <typename AssignTo,
2071  typename ConvertTo,
2072  enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value && !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2073  classify_object<AssignTo>::value == object_category::wrapper_value,
2074  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2075 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2076  if(input.empty()) {
2077  typename AssignTo::value_type emptyVal{};
2078  output = emptyVal;
2079  return true;
2080  }
2081  return lexical_cast(input, output);
2082 }
2083 
2086 template <typename AssignTo,
2087  typename ConvertTo,
2088  enable_if_t<std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value && !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, AssignTo>::value &&
2089  classify_object<AssignTo>::value != object_category::wrapper_value &&
2090  std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, int>::value,
2091  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2092 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2093  if(input.empty()) {
2094  output = 0;
2095  return true;
2096  }
2097  int val = 0;
2098  if(lexical_cast(input, val)) {
2099  output = val;
2100  return true;
2101  }
2102  return false;
2103 }
2104 
2106 template <typename AssignTo,
2107  typename ConvertTo,
2108  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value && std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo &>::value,
2109  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2110 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2111  ConvertTo val{};
2112  bool parse_result = (!input.empty()) ? lexical_cast<ConvertTo>(input, val) : true;
2113  if(parse_result) {
2114  output = val;
2115  }
2116  return parse_result;
2117 }
2118 
2120 template <
2121  typename AssignTo,
2122  typename ConvertTo,
2123  enable_if_t<!std::is_same<AssignTo, ConvertTo>::value && !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo &>::value &&
2124  std::is_move_assignable<AssignTo>::value,
2125  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2126 bool lexical_assign(const std::string &input, AssignTo &output) {
2127  ConvertTo val{};
2128  bool parse_result = input.empty() ? true : lexical_cast<ConvertTo>(input, val);
2129  if(parse_result) {
2130  output = AssignTo(val); // use () form of constructor to allow some implicit conversions
2131  }
2132  return parse_result;
2133 }
2134 
2136 template <typename AssignTo,
2137  typename ConvertTo,
2138  enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value <= object_category::other &&
2139  classify_object<AssignTo>::value <= object_category::wrapper_value,
2140  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2141 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2142  return lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2143 }
2144 
2147 template <typename AssignTo,
2148  typename ConvertTo,
2149  enable_if_t<(type_count<AssignTo>::value <= 2) && expected_count<AssignTo>::value == 1 &&
2150  is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value && type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2151  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2152 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2153  // the remove const is to handle pair types coming from a container
2154  typename std::remove_const<typename std::tuple_element<0, ConvertTo>::type>::type v1;
2155  typename std::tuple_element<1, ConvertTo>::type v2;
2156  bool retval = lexical_assign<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings[0], v1);
2157  if(strings.size() > 1) {
2158  retval = retval && lexical_assign<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings[1], v2);
2159  }
2160  if(retval) {
2161  output = AssignTo{v1, v2};
2162  }
2163  return retval;
2164 }
2165 
2167 template <class AssignTo,
2168  class ConvertTo,
2169  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2170  type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1,
2171  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2172 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2173  output.erase(output.begin(), output.end());
2174  if(strings.size() == 1 && strings[0] == "{}") {
2175  return true;
2176  }
2177  bool skip_remaining = false;
2178  if(strings.size() == 2 && strings[0] == "{}" && is_separator(strings[1])) {
2179  skip_remaining = true;
2180  }
2181  for(const auto &elem : strings) {
2182  typename AssignTo::value_type out;
2183  bool retval = lexical_assign<typename AssignTo::value_type, typename ConvertTo::value_type>(elem, out);
2184  if(!retval) {
2185  return false;
2186  }
2187  output.insert(output.end(), std::move(out));
2188  if(skip_remaining) {
2189  break;
2190  }
2191  }
2192  return (!output.empty());
2193 }
2194 
2196 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo, enable_if_t<is_complex<ConvertTo>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2197 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2198 
2199  if(strings.size() >= 2 && !strings[1].empty()) {
2200  using XC2 = typename wrapped_type<ConvertTo, double>::type;
2201  XC2 x{0.0}, y{0.0};
2202  auto str1 = strings[1];
2203  if(str1.back() == 'i' || str1.back() == 'j') {
2204  str1.pop_back();
2205  }
2206  auto worked = detail::lexical_cast(strings[0], x) && detail::lexical_cast(str1, y);
2207  if(worked) {
2208  output = ConvertTo{x, y};
2209  }
2210  return worked;
2211  }
2212  return lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2213 }
2214 
2216 template <class AssignTo,
2217  class ConvertTo,
2218  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && (expected_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1) &&
2219  (type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1),
2220  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2221 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2222  bool retval = true;
2223  output.clear();
2224  output.reserve(strings.size());
2225  for(const auto &elem : strings) {
2226 
2227  output.emplace_back();
2228  retval = retval && lexical_assign<typename AssignTo::value_type, ConvertTo>(elem, output.back());
2229  }
2230  return (!output.empty()) && retval;
2231 }
2232 
2233 // forward declaration
2234 
2236 template <class AssignTo,
2237  class ConvertTo,
2238  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2239  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2240  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2241 bool lexical_conversion(std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output);
2242 
2244 template <class AssignTo,
2245  class ConvertTo,
2246  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2247  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != 2 &&
2248  ((type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2) ||
2249  (type_count<ConvertTo>::value > type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value)),
2250  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2251 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output);
2252 
2254 template <class AssignTo,
2255  class ConvertTo,
2256  enable_if_t<is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value && is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value &&
2257  (type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != type_count<ConvertTo>::value ||
2258  type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2259  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2260 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output); // forward declaration
2261 
2264 template <typename AssignTo,
2265  typename ConvertTo,
2266  enable_if_t<!is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value && !is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value &&
2267  classify_object<ConvertTo>::value != object_category::wrapper_value &&
2268  (is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value || type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2269  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2270 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2271 
2272  if(strings.size() > 1 || (!strings.empty() && !(strings.front().empty()))) {
2273  ConvertTo val;
2274  auto retval = lexical_conversion<ConvertTo, ConvertTo>(strings, val);
2275  output = AssignTo{val};
2276  return retval;
2277  }
2278  output = AssignTo{};
2279  return true;
2280 }
2281 
2283 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo, std::size_t I>
2284 inline typename std::enable_if<(I >= type_count_base<AssignTo>::value), bool>::type
2285 tuple_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &, AssignTo &) {
2286  return true;
2287 }
2288 
2290 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2291 inline typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value && type_count<ConvertTo>::value == 1, bool>::type
2292 tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2293  auto retval = lexical_assign<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings[0], output);
2294  strings.erase(strings.begin());
2295  return retval;
2296 }
2297 
2299 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2300 inline typename std::enable_if<!is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value && (type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 1) &&
2301  type_count<ConvertTo>::value == type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value,
2302  bool>::type
2303 tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2304  auto retval = lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(strings, output);
2305  strings.erase(strings.begin(), strings.begin() + type_count<ConvertTo>::value);
2306  return retval;
2307 }
2308 
2310 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo>
2311 inline typename std::enable_if<is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value ||
2312  type_count<ConvertTo>::value != type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value,
2313  bool>::type
2314 tuple_type_conversion(std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2315 
2316  std::size_t index{subtype_count_min<ConvertTo>::value};
2317  const std::size_t mx_count{subtype_count<ConvertTo>::value};
2318  const std::size_t mx{(std::max)(mx_count, strings.size())};
2319 
2320  while(index < mx) {
2321  if(is_separator(strings[index])) {
2322  break;
2323  }
2324  ++index;
2325  }
2326  bool retval = lexical_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo>(
2327  std::vector<std::string>(strings.begin(), strings.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(index)), output);
2328  strings.erase(strings.begin(), strings.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(index) + 1);
2329  return retval;
2330 }
2331 
2333 template <class AssignTo, class ConvertTo, std::size_t I>
2334 inline typename std::enable_if<(I < type_count_base<AssignTo>::value), bool>::type
2335 tuple_conversion(std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output) {
2336  bool retval = true;
2337  using ConvertToElement = typename std::
2338  conditional<is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value, typename std::tuple_element<I, ConvertTo>::type, ConvertTo>::type;
2339  if(!strings.empty()) {
2340  retval = retval && tuple_type_conversion<typename std::tuple_element<I, AssignTo>::type, ConvertToElement>(
2341  strings, std::get<I>(output));
2342  }
2343  retval = retval && tuple_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo, I + 1>(std::move(strings), output);
2344  return retval;
2345 }
2346 
2348 template <class AssignTo,
2349  class ConvertTo,
2350  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2351  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value == 2,
2352  detail::enabler>>
2353 bool lexical_conversion(std::vector<std::string> strings, AssignTo &output) {
2354  output.clear();
2355  while(!strings.empty()) {
2356 
2357  typename std::remove_const<typename std::tuple_element<0, typename ConvertTo::value_type>::type>::type v1;
2358  typename std::tuple_element<1, typename ConvertTo::value_type>::type v2;
2359  bool retval = tuple_type_conversion<decltype(v1), decltype(v1)>(strings, v1);
2360  if(!strings.empty()) {
2361  retval = retval && tuple_type_conversion<decltype(v2), decltype(v2)>(strings, v2);
2362  }
2363  if(retval) {
