2364  output.insert(output.end(), typename AssignTo::value_type{v1, v2});
2365  } else {
2366  return false;
2367  }
2368  }
2369  return (!output.empty());
2370 }
2371 
2373 template <class AssignTo,
2374  class ConvertTo,
2375  enable_if_t<is_tuple_like<AssignTo>::value && is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value &&
2376  (type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != type_count<ConvertTo>::value ||
2377  type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2),
2378  detail::enabler>>
2379 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2380  static_assert(
2381  !is_tuple_like<ConvertTo>::value || type_count_base<AssignTo>::value == type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value,
2382  "if the conversion type is defined as a tuple it must be the same size as the type you are converting to");
2383  return tuple_conversion<AssignTo, ConvertTo, 0>(strings, output);
2384 }
2385 
2387 template <class AssignTo,
2388  class ConvertTo,
2389  enable_if_t<is_mutable_container<AssignTo>::value && is_mutable_container<ConvertTo>::value &&
2390  type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value != 2 &&
2391  ((type_count<ConvertTo>::value > 2) ||
2392  (type_count<ConvertTo>::value > type_count_base<ConvertTo>::value)),
2393  detail::enabler>>
2394 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std ::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2395  bool retval = true;
2396  output.clear();
2397  std::vector<std::string> temp;
2398  std::size_t ii{0};
2399  std::size_t icount{0};
2400  std::size_t xcm{type_count<ConvertTo>::value};
2401  auto ii_max = strings.size();
2402  while(ii < ii_max) {
2403  temp.push_back(strings[ii]);
2404  ++ii;
2405  ++icount;
2406  if(icount == xcm || is_separator(temp.back()) || ii == ii_max) {
2407  if(static_cast<int>(xcm) > type_count_min<ConvertTo>::value && is_separator(temp.back())) {
2408  temp.pop_back();
2409  }
2410  typename AssignTo::value_type temp_out;
2411  retval = retval &&
2412  lexical_conversion<typename AssignTo::value_type, typename ConvertTo::value_type>(temp, temp_out);
2413  temp.clear();
2414  if(!retval) {
2415  return false;
2416  }
2417  output.insert(output.end(), std::move(temp_out));
2418  icount = 0;
2419  }
2420  }
2421  return retval;
2422 }
2423 
2425 template <typename AssignTo,
2426  class ConvertTo,
2427  enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
2428  std::is_assignable<ConvertTo &, ConvertTo>::value,
2429  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2430 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2431  if(strings.empty() || strings.front().empty()) {
2432  output = ConvertTo{};
2433  return true;
2434  }
2435  typename ConvertTo::value_type val;
2436  if(lexical_conversion<typename ConvertTo::value_type, typename ConvertTo::value_type>(strings, val)) {
2437  output = ConvertTo{val};
2438  return true;
2439  }
2440  return false;
2441 }
2442 
2444 template <typename AssignTo,
2445  class ConvertTo,
2446  enable_if_t<classify_object<ConvertTo>::value == object_category::wrapper_value &&
2447  !std::is_assignable<AssignTo &, ConvertTo>::value,
2448  detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
2449 bool lexical_conversion(const std::vector<std::string> &strings, AssignTo &output) {
2450  using ConvertType = typename ConvertTo::value_type;
2451  if(strings.empty() || strings.front().empty()) {
2452  output = ConvertType{};
2453  return true;
2454  }
2455  ConvertType val;
2456  if(lexical_conversion<typename ConvertTo::value_type, typename ConvertTo::value_type>(strings, val)) {
2457  output = val;
2458  return true;
2459  }
2460  return false;
2461 }
2462 
2464 inline std::string sum_string_vector(const std::vector<std::string> &values) {
2465  double val{0.0};
2466  bool fail{false};
2467  std::string output;
2468  for(const auto &arg : values) {
2469  double tv{0.0};
2470  auto comp = detail::lexical_cast<double>(arg, tv);
2471  if(!comp) {
2472  try {
2473  tv = static_cast<double>(detail::to_flag_value(arg));
2474  } catch(const std::exception &) {
2475  fail = true;
2476  break;
2477  }
2478  }
2479  val += tv;
2480  }
2481  if(fail) {
2482  for(const auto &arg : values) {
2483  output.append(arg);
2484  }
2485  } else {
2486  if(val <= static_cast<double>((std::numeric_limits<std::int64_t>::min)()) ||
2487  val >= static_cast<double>((std::numeric_limits<std::int64_t>::max)()) ||
2488  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(clang-diagnostic-float-equal,bugprone-narrowing-conversions)
2489  val == static_cast<std::int64_t>(val)) {
2490  output = detail::value_string(static_cast<int64_t>(val));
2491  } else {
2492  output = detail::value_string(val);
2493  }
2494  }
2495  return output;
2496 }
2497 
2498 } // namespace detail
2499 
2500 
2501 
2502 namespace detail {
2503 
2504 // Returns false if not a short option. Otherwise, sets opt name and rest and returns true
2505 CLI11_INLINE bool split_short(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &rest);
2506 
2507 // Returns false if not a long option. Otherwise, sets opt name and other side of = and returns true
2508 CLI11_INLINE bool split_long(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value);
2509 
2510 // Returns false if not a windows style option. Otherwise, sets opt name and value and returns true
2511 CLI11_INLINE bool split_windows_style(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value);
2512 
2513 // Splits a string into multiple long and short names
2514 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_names(std::string current);
2515 
2517 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> get_default_flag_values(const std::string &str);
2518 
2520 CLI11_INLINE std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>, std::string>
2521 get_names(const std::vector<std::string> &input);
2522 
2523 } // namespace detail
2524 
2525 
2526 
2527 namespace detail {
2528 
2529 CLI11_INLINE bool split_short(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &rest) {
2530  if(current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '-' && valid_first_char(current[1])) {
2531  name = current.substr(1, 1);
2532  rest = current.substr(2);
2533  return true;
2534  }
2535  return false;
2536 }
2537 
2538 CLI11_INLINE bool split_long(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value) {
2539  if(current.size() > 2 && current.substr(0, 2) == "--" && valid_first_char(current[2])) {
2540  auto loc = current.find_first_of('=');
2541  if(loc != std::string::npos) {
2542  name = current.substr(2, loc - 2);
2543  value = current.substr(loc + 1);
2544  } else {
2545  name = current.substr(2);
2546  value = "";
2547  }
2548  return true;
2549  }
2550  return false;
2551 }
2552 
2553 CLI11_INLINE bool split_windows_style(const std::string &current, std::string &name, std::string &value) {
2554  if(current.size() > 1 && current[0] == '/' && valid_first_char(current[1])) {
2555  auto loc = current.find_first_of(':');
2556  if(loc != std::string::npos) {
2557  name = current.substr(1, loc - 1);
2558  value = current.substr(loc + 1);
2559  } else {
2560  name = current.substr(1);
2561  value = "";
2562  }
2563  return true;
2564  }
2565  return false;
2566 }
2567 
2568 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> split_names(std::string current) {
2569  std::vector<std::string> output;
2570  std::size_t val = 0;
2571  while((val = current.find(',')) != std::string::npos) {
2572  output.push_back(trim_copy(current.substr(0, val)));
2573  current = current.substr(val + 1);
2574  }
2575  output.push_back(trim_copy(current));
2576  return output;
2577 }
2578 
2579 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> get_default_flag_values(const std::string &str) {
2580  std::vector<std::string> flags = split_names(str);
2581  flags.erase(std::remove_if(flags.begin(),
2582  flags.end(),
2583  [](const std::string &name) {
2584  return ((name.empty()) || (!(((name.find_first_of('{') != std::string::npos) &&
2585  (name.back() == '}')) ||
2586  (name[0] == '!'))));
2587  }),
2588  flags.end());
2589  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> output;
2590  output.reserve(flags.size());
2591  for(auto &flag : flags) {
2592  auto def_start = flag.find_first_of('{');
2593  std::string defval = "false";
2594  if((def_start != std::string::npos) && (flag.back() == '}')) {
2595  defval = flag.substr(def_start + 1);
2596  defval.pop_back();
2597  flag.erase(def_start, std::string::npos); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
2598  }
2599  flag.erase(0, flag.find_first_not_of("-!"));
2600  output.emplace_back(flag, defval);
2601  }
2602  return output;
2603 }
2604 
2605 CLI11_INLINE std::tuple<std::vector<std::string>, std::vector<std::string>, std::string>
2606 get_names(const std::vector<std::string> &input) {
2607 
2608  std::vector<std::string> short_names;
2609  std::vector<std::string> long_names;
2610  std::string pos_name;
2611 
2612  for(std::string name : input) {
2613  if(name.length() == 0) {
2614  continue;
2615  }
2616  if(name.length() > 1 && name[0] == '-' && name[1] != '-') {
2617  if(name.length() == 2 && valid_first_char(name[1]))
2618  short_names.emplace_back(1, name[1]);
2619  else
2620  throw BadNameString::OneCharName(name);
2621  } else if(name.length() > 2 && name.substr(0, 2) == "--") {
2622  name = name.substr(2);
2623  if(valid_name_string(name))
2624  long_names.push_back(name);
2625  else
2626  throw BadNameString::BadLongName(name);
2627  } else if(name == "-" || name == "--") {
2628  throw BadNameString::DashesOnly(name);
2629  } else {
2630  if(pos_name.length() > 0)
2631  throw BadNameString::MultiPositionalNames(name);
2632  pos_name = name;
2633  }
2634  }
2635 
2636  return std::make_tuple(short_names, long_names, pos_name);
2637 }
2638 
2639 } // namespace detail
2640 
2641 
2642 
2643 class App;
2644 
2646 struct ConfigItem {
2648  std::vector<std::string> parents{};
2649 
2651  std::string name{};
2652 
2654  std::vector<std::string> inputs{};
2655 
2657  CLI11_NODISCARD std::string fullname() const {
2658  std::vector<std::string> tmp = parents;
2659  tmp.emplace_back(name);
2660  return detail::join(tmp, ".");
2661  }
2662 };
2663 
2665 class Config {
2666  protected:
2667  std::vector<ConfigItem> items{};
2668 
2669  public:
2671  virtual std::string to_config(const App *, bool, bool, std::string) const = 0;
2672 
2674  virtual std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &) const = 0;
2675 
2677  CLI11_NODISCARD virtual std::string to_flag(const ConfigItem &item) const {
2678  if(item.inputs.size() == 1) {
2679  return item.inputs.at(0);
2680  }
2681  if(item.inputs.empty()) {
2682  return "{}";
2683  }
2684  throw ConversionError::TooManyInputsFlag(item.fullname()); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
2685  }
2686 
2688  CLI11_NODISCARD std::vector<ConfigItem> from_file(const std::string &name) const {
2689  b::fs::ifstream input(name); // BATTERY MODIFIED
2690  if(!input.good())
2691  throw FileError::Missing(name);
2692 
2693  return from_config(input);
2694  }
2695 
2697  virtual ~Config() = default;
2698 };
2699 
2701 class ConfigBase : public Config {
2702  protected:
2704  char commentChar = '#';
2706  char arrayStart = '[';
2708  char arrayEnd = ']';
2710  char arraySeparator = ',';
2712  char valueDelimiter = '=';
2714  char stringQuote = '"';
2716  char characterQuote = '\'';
2718  uint8_t maximumLayers{255};
2720  char parentSeparatorChar{'.'};
2722  int16_t configIndex{-1};
2724  std::string configSection{};
2725 
2726  public:
2727  std::string
2728  to_config(const App * /*app*/, bool default_also, bool write_description, std::string prefix) const override;
2729 
2730  std::vector<ConfigItem> from_config(std::istream &input) const override;
2732  ConfigBase *comment(char cchar) {
2733  commentChar = cchar;
2734  return this;
2735  }
2737  ConfigBase *arrayBounds(char aStart, char aEnd) {
2738  arrayStart = aStart;
2739  arrayEnd = aEnd;
2740  return this;
2741  }
2743  ConfigBase *arrayDelimiter(char aSep) {
2744  arraySeparator = aSep;
2745  return this;
2746  }
2748  ConfigBase *valueSeparator(char vSep) {
2749  valueDelimiter = vSep;
2750  return this;
2751  }
2753  ConfigBase *quoteCharacter(char qString, char qChar) {
2754  stringQuote = qString;
2755  characterQuote = qChar;
2756  return this;
2757  }
2759  ConfigBase *maxLayers(uint8_t layers) {
2760  maximumLayers = layers;
2761  return this;
2762  }
2764  ConfigBase *parentSeparator(char sep) {
2765  parentSeparatorChar = sep;
2766  return this;
2767  }
2769  std::string &sectionRef() { return configSection; }
2771  CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &section() const { return configSection; }
2773  ConfigBase *section(const std::string &sectionName) {
2774  configSection = sectionName;
2775  return this;
2776  }
2777 
2779  int16_t &indexRef() { return configIndex; }
2781  CLI11_NODISCARD int16_t index() const { return configIndex; }
2783  ConfigBase *index(int16_t sectionIndex) {
2784  configIndex = sectionIndex;
2785  return this;
2786  }
2787 };
2788 
2790 using ConfigTOML = ConfigBase;
2791 
2793 class ConfigINI : public ConfigTOML {
2794 
2795  public:
2796  ConfigINI() {
2797  commentChar = ';';
2798  arrayStart = '\0';
2799  arrayEnd = '\0';
2800  arraySeparator = ' ';
2801  valueDelimiter = '=';
2802  }
2803 };

2806 
2807 class Option;

2810 
2817 
2819 class Validator {
2820  protected:
2822  std::function<std::string()> desc_function_{[]() { return std::string{}; }};
2823 
2826  std::function<std::string(std::string &)> func_{[](std::string &) { return std::string{}; }};
2828  std::string name_{};
2830  int application_index_ = -1;
2832  bool active_{true};
2834  bool non_modifying_{false};
2835 
2836  Validator(std::string validator_desc, std::function<std::string(std::string &)> func)
2837  : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }), func_(std::move(func)) {}
2838 
2839  public:
2840  Validator() = default;
2842  explicit Validator(std::string validator_desc) : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }) {}
2844  Validator(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op, std::string validator_desc, std::string validator_name = "")
2845  : desc_function_([validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; }), func_(std::move(op)),
2846  name_(std::move(validator_name)) {}
2848  Validator &operation(std::function<std::string(std::string &)> op) {
2849  func_ = std::move(op);
2850  return *this;
2851  }
2854  std::string operator()(std::string &str) const;
2855 
2858  std::string operator()(const std::string &str) const {
2859  std::string value = str;
2860  return (active_) ? func_(value) : std::string{};
2861  }
2862 
2864  Validator &description(std::string validator_desc) {
2865  desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
2866  return *this;
2867  }
2869  CLI11_NODISCARD Validator description(std::string validator_desc) const;
2870 
2872  CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_description() const {
2873  if(active_) {
2874  return desc_function_();
2875  }
2876  return std::string{};
2877  }
2879  Validator &name(std::string validator_name) {
2880  name_ = std::move(validator_name);
2881  return *this;
2882  }
2884  CLI11_NODISCARD Validator name(std::string validator_name) const {
2885  Validator newval(*this);
2886  newval.name_ = std::move(validator_name);
2887  return newval;
2888  }
2890  CLI11_NODISCARD const std::string &get_name() const { return name_; }
2892  Validator &active(bool active_val = true) {
2893  active_ = active_val;
2894  return *this;
2895  }
2897  CLI11_NODISCARD Validator active(bool active_val = true) const {
2898  Validator newval(*this);
2899  newval.active_ = active_val;
2900  return newval;
2901  }
2902 
2904  Validator &non_modifying(bool no_modify = true) {
2905  non_modifying_ = no_modify;
2906  return *this;
2907  }
2909  Validator &application_index(int app_index) {
2910  application_index_ = app_index;
2911  return *this;
2912  }
2914  CLI11_NODISCARD Validator application_index(int app_index) const {
2915  Validator newval(*this);
2916  newval.application_index_ = app_index;
2917  return newval;
2918  }
2920  CLI11_NODISCARD int get_application_index() const { return application_index_; }
2922  CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_active() const { return active_; }
2923 
2925  CLI11_NODISCARD bool get_modifying() const { return !non_modifying_; }
2926 
2929  Validator operator&(const Validator &other) const;
2930 
2933  Validator operator|(const Validator &other) const;
2934 
2936  Validator operator!() const;
2937 
2938  private:
2939  void _merge_description(const Validator &val1, const Validator &val2, const std::string &merger);
2940 };
2941 
2943 class CustomValidator : public Validator {
2944  public:
2945 };
2946 // The implementation of the built in validators is using the Validator class;
2947 // the user is only expected to use the const (static) versions (since there's no setup).
2948 // Therefore, this is in detail.
2949 namespace detail {
2950 
2952 enum class path_type { nonexistent, file, directory };
2953 
2955 CLI11_INLINE path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept;
2956 
2958 class ExistingFileValidator : public Validator {
2959  public:
2960  ExistingFileValidator();
2961 };
2962 
2964 class ExistingDirectoryValidator : public Validator {
2965  public:
2966  ExistingDirectoryValidator();
2967 };
2968 
2970 class ExistingPathValidator : public Validator {
2971  public:
2972  ExistingPathValidator();
2973 };
2974 
2976 class NonexistentPathValidator : public Validator {
2977  public:
2978  NonexistentPathValidator();
2979 };
2980 
2982 class IPV4Validator : public Validator {
2983  public:
2984  IPV4Validator();
2985 };
2986 
2987 } // namespace detail
2988 
2989 // Static is not needed here, because global const implies static.
2990 
2992 const detail::ExistingFileValidator ExistingFile;
2993 
2995 const detail::ExistingDirectoryValidator ExistingDirectory;
2996

3005 
3007 template <typename DesiredType> class TypeValidator : public Validator {
3008  public:
3009  explicit TypeValidator(const std::string &validator_name)
3010  : Validator(validator_name, [](std::string &input_string) {
3011  auto val = DesiredType();
3012  if(!detail::lexical_cast(input_string, val)) {
3013  return std::string("Failed parsing ") + input_string + " as a " + detail::type_name<DesiredType>();
3014  }
3015  return std::string();
3016  }) {}
3017  TypeValidator() : TypeValidator(detail::type_name<DesiredType>()) {}
3018 };
3019 
3021 const TypeValidator<double> Number("NUMBER");
3022 
3025 class FileOnDefaultPath : public Validator {
3026  public:
3027  explicit FileOnDefaultPath(std::string default_path, bool enableErrorReturn = true);
3028 };
3029 
3031 class Range : public Validator {
3032  public:
3037  template <typename T>
3038  Range(T min_val, T max_val, const std::string &validator_name = std::string{}) : Validator(validator_name) {
3039  if(validator_name.empty()) {
3040  std::stringstream out;
3041  out << detail::type_name<T>() << " in [" << min_val << " - " << max_val << "]";
3042  description(out.str());
3043  }
3044 
3045  func_ = [min_val, max_val](std::string &input) {
3046  T val;
3047  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
3048  if((!converted) || (val < min_val || val > max_val)) {
3049  std::stringstream out;
3050  out << "Value " << input << " not in range [";
3051  out << min_val << " - " << max_val << "]";
3052  return out.str();
3053  }
3054  return std::string{};
3055  };
3056  }
3057 
3059  template <typename T>
3060  explicit Range(T max_val, const std::string &validator_name = std::string{})
3061  : Range(static_cast<T>(0), max_val, validator_name) {}
3062 };
3063 
3065 const Range NonNegativeNumber((std::numeric_limits<double>::max)(), "NONNEGATIVE");
3066 
3068 const Range PositiveNumber((std::numeric_limits<double>::min)(), (std::numeric_limits<double>::max)(), "POSITIVE");
3069 
3071 class Bound : public Validator {
3072  public:
3077  template <typename T> Bound(T min_val, T max_val) {
3078  std::stringstream out;
3079  out << detail::type_name<T>() << " bounded to [" << min_val << " - " << max_val << "]";
3080  description(out.str());
3081 
3082  func_ = [min_val, max_val](std::string &input) {
3083  T val;
3084  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, val);
3085  if(!converted) {
3086  return std::string("Value ") + input + " could not be converted";
3087  }
3088  if(val < min_val)
3089  input = detail::to_string(min_val);
3090  else if(val > max_val)
3091  input = detail::to_string(max_val);
3092 
3093  return std::string{};
3094  };
3095  }
3096 
3098  template <typename T> explicit Bound(T max_val) : Bound(static_cast<T>(0), max_val) {}
3099 };
3100 
3101 namespace detail {
3102 template <typename T,
3103  enable_if_t<is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3104 auto smart_deref(T value) -> decltype(*value) {
3105  return *value;
3106 }
3107 
3108 template <
3109  typename T,
3110  enable_if_t<!is_copyable_ptr<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3111 typename std::remove_reference<T>::type &smart_deref(T &value) {
3112  return value;
3113 }
3115 template <typename T> std::string generate_set(const T &set) {
3116  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3117  using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
3118  std::string out(1, '{');
3119  out.append(detail::join(
3120  detail::smart_deref(set),
3121  [](const iteration_type_t &v) { return detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v); },
3122  ","));
3123  out.push_back('}');
3124  return out;
3125 }
3126 
3128 template <typename T> std::string generate_map(const T &map, bool key_only = false) {
3129  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3130  using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
3131  std::string out(1, '{');
3132  out.append(detail::join(
3133  detail::smart_deref(map),
3134  [key_only](const iteration_type_t &v) {
3135  std::string res{detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v))};
3136 
3137  if(!key_only) {
3138  res.append("->");
3139  res += detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
3140  }
3141  return res;
3142  },
3143  ","));
3144  out.push_back('}');
3145  return out;
3146 }
3147 
3148 template <typename C, typename V> struct has_find {
3149  template <typename CC, typename VV>
3150  static auto test(int) -> decltype(std::declval<CC>().find(std::declval<VV>()), std::true_type());
3151  template <typename, typename> static auto test(...) -> decltype(std::false_type());
3152 
3153  static const auto value = decltype(test<C, V>(0))::value;
3154  using type = std::integral_constant<bool, value>;
3155 };
3156 
3158 template <typename T, typename V, enable_if_t<!has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3159 auto search(const T &set, const V &val) -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3160  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3161  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3162  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref), [&val](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
3163  return (detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v) == val);
3164  });
3165  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3166 }
3167 
3169 template <typename T, typename V, enable_if_t<has_find<T, V>::value, detail::enabler> = detail::dummy>
3170 auto search(const T &set, const V &val) -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3171  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3172  auto it = setref.find(val);
3173  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3174 }
3175 
3177 template <typename T, typename V>
3178 auto search(const T &set, const V &val, const std::function<V(V)> &filter_function)
3179  -> std::pair<bool, decltype(std::begin(detail::smart_deref(set)))> {
3180  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type;
3181  // do the potentially faster first search
3182  auto res = search(set, val);
3183  if((res.first) || (!(filter_function))) {
3184  return res;
3185  }
3186  // if we haven't found it do the longer linear search with all the element translations
3187  auto &setref = detail::smart_deref(set);
3188  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(setref), std::end(setref), [&](decltype(*std::begin(setref)) v) {
3189  V a{detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(v)};
3190  a = filter_function(a);
3191  return (a == val);
3192  });
3193  return {(it != std::end(setref)), it};
3194 }
3195 
3196 // the following suggestion was made by Nikita Ofitserov(@himikof)
3197 // done in templates to prevent compiler warnings on negation of unsigned numbers
3198 
3200 template <typename T>
3201 inline typename std::enable_if<std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type overflowCheck(const T &a, const T &b) {
3202  if((a > 0) == (b > 0)) {
3203  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / (std::abs)(a) < (std::abs)(b));
3204  }
3205  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() / (std::abs)(a) > -(std::abs)(b));
3206 }
3208 template <typename T>
3209 inline typename std::enable_if<!std::is_signed<T>::value, T>::type overflowCheck(const T &a, const T &b) {
3210  return ((std::numeric_limits<T>::max)() / a < b);
3211 }
3212 
3214 template <typename T> typename std::enable_if<std::is_integral<T>::value, bool>::type checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
3215  if(a == 0 || b == 0 || a == 1 || b == 1) {
3216  a *= b;
3217  return true;
3218  }
3219  if(a == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)() || b == (std::numeric_limits<T>::min)()) {
3220  return false;
3221  }
3222  if(overflowCheck(a, b)) {
3223  return false;
3224  }
3225  a *= b;
3226  return true;
3227 }
3228 
3230 template <typename T>
3231 typename std::enable_if<std::is_floating_point<T>::value, bool>::type checked_multiply(T &a, T b) {
3232  T c = a * b;
3233  if(std::isinf(c) && !std::isinf(a) && !std::isinf(b)) {
3234  return false;
3235  }
3236  a = c;
3237  return true;
3238 }
3239 
3240 } // namespace detail
3242 class IsMember : public Validator {
3243  public:
3244  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3245 
3247  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3248  IsMember(std::initializer_list<T> values, Args &&...args)
3249  : IsMember(std::vector<T>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3250 
3252  template <typename T> explicit IsMember(T &&set) : IsMember(std::forward<T>(set), nullptr) {}
3253 
3256  template <typename T, typename F> explicit IsMember(T set, F filter_function) {
3257 
3258  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
3259  // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
3260  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
3261  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3262 
3263  using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // This will convert bad types to good ones
3264  // (const char * to std::string)
3265 
3266  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
3267  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3268 
3269  // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of the set contents
3270  desc_function_ = [set]() { return detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set)); };
3271 
3272  // This is the function that validates
3273  // It stores a copy of the set pointer-like, so shared_ptr will stay alive
3274  func_ = [set, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3275  local_item_t b;
3276  if(!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
3277  throw ValidationError(input); // name is added later
3278  }
3279  if(filter_fn) {
3280  b = filter_fn(b);
3281  }
3282  auto res = detail::search(set, b, filter_fn);
3283  if(res.first) {
3284  // Make sure the version in the input string is identical to the one in the set
3285  if(filter_fn) {
3286  input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first(*(res.second)));
3287  }
3288 
3289  // Return empty error string (success)
3290  return std::string{};
3291  }
3292 
3293  // If you reach this point, the result was not found
3294  return input + " not in " + detail::generate_set(detail::smart_deref(set));
3295  };
3296  }
3297 
3299  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3300  IsMember(T &&set, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&...other)
3301  : IsMember(
3302  std::forward<T>(set),
3303  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
3304  other...) {}
3305 };
3306 
3308 template <typename T> using TransformPairs = std::vector<std::pair<std::string, T>>;
3309 
3311 class Transformer : public Validator {
3312  public:
3313  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3314 
3316  template <typename... Args>
3317  Transformer(std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values, Args &&...args)
3318  : Transformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3319 
3321  template <typename T> explicit Transformer(T &&mapping) : Transformer(std::forward<T>(mapping), nullptr) {}
3322 
3325  template <typename T, typename F> explicit Transformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
3326 
3327  static_assert(detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
3328  "mapping must produce value pairs");
3329  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
3330  // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
3331  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
3332  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3333  using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // Will convert bad types to good ones
3334  // (const char * to std::string)
3335 
3336  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
3337  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3338 
3339  // This is the type name for help, it will take the current version of the set contents
3340  desc_function_ = [mapping]() { return detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)); };
3341 
3342  func_ = [mapping, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3343  local_item_t b;
3344  if(!detail::lexical_cast(input, b)) {
3345  return std::string();
3346  // there is no possible way we can match anything in the mapping if we can't convert so just return
3347  }
3348  if(filter_fn) {
3349  b = filter_fn(b);
3350  }
3351  auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
3352  if(res.first) {
3353  input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
3354  }
3355  return std::string{};
3356  };
3357  }
3358 
3360  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3361  Transformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&...other)
3362  : Transformer(
3363  std::forward<T>(mapping),
3364  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
3365  other...) {}
3366 };
3367 
3369 class CheckedTransformer : public Validator {
3370  public:
3371  using filter_fn_t = std::function<std::string(std::string)>;
3372 
3374  template <typename... Args>
3375  CheckedTransformer(std::initializer_list<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> values, Args &&...args)
3376  : CheckedTransformer(TransformPairs<std::string>(values), std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
3377 
3379  template <typename T> explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping) : CheckedTransformer(std::move(mapping), nullptr) {}
3380 
3383  template <typename T, typename F> explicit CheckedTransformer(T mapping, F filter_function) {
3384 
3385  static_assert(detail::pair_adaptor<typename detail::element_type<T>::type>::value,
3386  "mapping must produce value pairs");
3387  // Get the type of the contained item - requires a container have ::value_type
3388  // if the type does not have first_type and second_type, these are both value_type
3389  using element_t = typename detail::element_type<T>::type; // Removes (smart) pointers if needed
3390  using item_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::first_type; // Is value_type if not a map
3391  using local_item_t = typename IsMemberType<item_t>::type; // Will convert bad types to good ones
3392  // (const char * to std::string)
3393  using iteration_type_t = typename detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::value_type; // the type of the object pair
3394 
3395  // Make a local copy of the filter function, using a std::function if not one already
3396  std::function<local_item_t(local_item_t)> filter_fn = filter_function;
3397 
3398  auto tfunc = [mapping]() {
3399  std::string out("value in ");
3400  out += detail::generate_map(detail::smart_deref(mapping)) + " OR {";
3401  out += detail::join(
3402  detail::smart_deref(mapping),
3403  [](const iteration_type_t &v) { return detail::to_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v)); },
3404  ",");
3405  out.push_back('}');
3406  return out;
3407  };
3408 
3409  desc_function_ = tfunc;
3410 
3411  func_ = [mapping, tfunc, filter_fn](std::string &input) {
3412  local_item_t b;
3413  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, b);
3414  if(converted) {
3415  if(filter_fn) {
3416  b = filter_fn(b);
3417  }
3418  auto res = detail::search(mapping, b, filter_fn);
3419  if(res.first) {
3420  input = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(*res.second));
3421  return std::string{};
3422  }
3423  }
3424  for(const auto &v : detail::smart_deref(mapping)) {
3425  auto output_string = detail::value_string(detail::pair_adaptor<element_t>::second(v));
3426  if(output_string == input) {
3427  return std::string();
3428  }
3429  }
3430 
3431  return "Check " + input + " " + tfunc() + " FAILED";
3432  };
3433  }
3434 
3436  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3437  CheckedTransformer(T &&mapping, filter_fn_t filter_fn_1, filter_fn_t filter_fn_2, Args &&...other)
3438  : CheckedTransformer(
3439  std::forward<T>(mapping),
3440  [filter_fn_1, filter_fn_2](std::string a) { return filter_fn_2(filter_fn_1(a)); },
3441  other...) {}
3442 };
3443 
3445 inline std::string ignore_case(std::string item) { return detail::to_lower(item); }
3446 
3448 inline std::string ignore_underscore(std::string item) { return detail::remove_underscore(item); }
3449 
3451 inline std::string ignore_space(std::string item) {
3452  item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), ' '), std::end(item));
3453  item.erase(std::remove(std::begin(item), std::end(item), '\t'), std::end(item));
3454  return item;
3455 }
3456 
3468 class AsNumberWithUnit : public Validator {
3469  public:
3474  enum Options {
3475  CASE_SENSITIVE = 0,
3476  CASE_INSENSITIVE = 1,
3477  UNIT_OPTIONAL = 0,
3478  UNIT_REQUIRED = 2,
3479  DEFAULT = CASE_INSENSITIVE | UNIT_OPTIONAL
3480  };
3481 
3482  template <typename Number>
3483  explicit AsNumberWithUnit(std::map<std::string, Number> mapping,
3484  Options opts = DEFAULT,
3485  const std::string &unit_name = "UNIT") {
3486  description(generate_description<Number>(unit_name, opts));
3487  validate_mapping(mapping, opts);
3488 
3489  // transform function
3490  func_ = [mapping, opts](std::string &input) -> std::string {
3491  Number num{};
3492 
3493  detail::rtrim(input);
3494  if(input.empty()) {
3495  throw ValidationError("Input is empty");
3496  }
3497 
3498  // Find split position between number and prefix
3499  auto unit_begin = input.end();
3500  while(unit_begin > input.begin() && std::isalpha(*(unit_begin - 1), std::locale())) {
3501  --unit_begin;
3502  }
3503 
3504  std::string unit{unit_begin, input.end()};
3505  input.resize(static_cast<std::size_t>(std::distance(input.begin(), unit_begin)));
3506  detail::trim(input);
3507 
3508  if(opts & UNIT_REQUIRED && unit.empty()) {
3509  throw ValidationError("Missing mandatory unit");
3510  }
3511  if(opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
3512  unit = detail::to_lower(unit);
3513  }
3514  if(unit.empty()) {
3515  if(!detail::lexical_cast(input, num)) {
3516  throw ValidationError(std::string("Value ") + input + " could not be converted to " +
3517  detail::type_name<Number>());
3518  }
3519  // No need to modify input if no unit passed
3520  return {};
3521  }
3522 
3523  // find corresponding factor
3524  auto it = mapping.find(unit);
3525  if(it == mapping.end()) {
3526  throw ValidationError(unit +
3527  " unit not recognized. "
3528  "Allowed values: " +
3529  detail::generate_map(mapping, true));
3530  }
3531 
3532  if(!input.empty()) {
3533  bool converted = detail::lexical_cast(input, num);
3534  if(!converted) {
3535  throw ValidationError(std::string("Value ") + input + " could not be converted to " +
3536  detail::type_name<Number>());
3537  }
3538  // perform safe multiplication
3539  bool ok = detail::checked_multiply(num, it->second);
3540  if(!ok) {
3541  throw ValidationError(detail::to_string(num) + " multiplied by " + unit +
3542  " factor would cause number overflow. Use smaller value.");
3543  }
3544  } else {
3545  num = static_cast<Number>(it->second);
3546  }
3547 
3548  input = detail::to_string(num);
3549 
3550  return {};
3551  };
3552  }
3553 
3554  private:
3557  template <typename Number> static void validate_mapping(std::map<std::string, Number> &mapping, Options opts) {
3558  for(auto &kv : mapping) {
3559  if(kv.first.empty()) {
3560  throw ValidationError("Unit must not be empty.");
3561  }
3562  if(!detail::isalpha(kv.first)) {
3563  throw ValidationError("Unit must contain only letters.");
3564  }
3565  }
3566 
3567  // make all units lowercase if CASE_INSENSITIVE
3568  if(opts & CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
3569  std::map<std::string, Number> lower_mapping;
3570  for(auto &kv : mapping) {
3571  auto s = detail::to_lower(kv.first);
3572  if(lower_mapping.count(s)) {
3573  throw ValidationError(std::string("Several matching lowercase unit representations are found: ") +
3574  s);
3575  }
3576  lower_mapping[detail::to_lower(kv.first)] = kv.second;
3577  }
3578  mapping = std::move(lower_mapping);
3579  }
3580  }
3581 
3583  template <typename Number> static std::string generate_description(const std::string &name, Options opts) {
3584  std::stringstream out;
3585  out << detail::type_name<Number>() << ' ';
3586  if(opts & UNIT_REQUIRED) {
3587  out << name;
3588  } else {
3589  out << '[' << name << ']';
3590  }
3591  return out.str();
3592  }
3593 };
3594 
3595 inline AsNumberWithUnit::Options operator|(const AsNumberWithUnit::Options &a, const AsNumberWithUnit::Options &b) {
3596  return static_cast<AsNumberWithUnit::Options>(static_cast<int>(a) | static_cast<int>(b));
3597 }
3598 
3610 class AsSizeValue : public AsNumberWithUnit {
3611  public:
3612  using result_t = std::uint64_t;
3613 
3621  explicit AsSizeValue(bool kb_is_1000);
3622 
3623  private:
3625  static std::map<std::string, result_t> init_mapping(bool kb_is_1000);
3626 
3628  static std::map<std::string, result_t> get_mapping(bool kb_is_1000);
3629 };
3630 
3631 namespace detail {
3636 CLI11_INLINE std::pair<std::string, std::string> split_program_name(std::string commandline);
3637 
3638 } // namespace detail
3640 
3641 
3642 
3643 
3644 CLI11_INLINE std::string Validator::operator()(std::string &str) const {
3645  std::string retstring;
3646  if(active_) {
3647  if(non_modifying_) {
3648  std::string value = str;
3649  retstring = func_(value);
3650  } else {
3651  retstring = func_(str);
3652  }
3653  }
3654  return retstring;
3655 }
3656 
3657 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::description(std::string validator_desc) const {
3658  Validator newval(*this);
3659  newval.desc_function_ = [validator_desc]() { return validator_desc; };
3660  return newval;
3661 }
3662 
3663 CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::operator&(const Validator &other) const {
3664  Validator newval;
3665 
3666  newval._merge_description(*this, other, " AND ");
3667 
3668  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3669  const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f1 = func_;
3670  const std::function<std::string(std::string & filename)> &f2 = other.func_;
3671 
3672  newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
3673  std::string s1 = f1(input);
3674  std::string s2 = f2(input);
3675  if(!s1.empty() && !s2.empty())
3676  return std::string("(") + s1 + ") AND (" + s2 + ")";
3677  return s1 + s2;
3678  };
3679 
3680  newval.active_ = active_ && other.active_;
3681  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3682  return newval;
3683 }
3684 
3685 CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::operator|(const Validator &other) const {
3686  Validator newval;
3687 
3688  newval._merge_description(*this, other, " OR ");
3689 
3690  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3691  const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f1 = func_;
3692  const std::function<std::string(std::string &)> &f2 = other.func_;
3693 
3694  newval.func_ = [f1, f2](std::string &input) {
3695  std::string s1 = f1(input);
3696  std::string s2 = f2(input);
3697  if(s1.empty() || s2.empty())
3698  return std::string();
3699 
3700  return std::string("(") + s1 + ") OR (" + s2 + ")";
3701  };
3702  newval.active_ = active_ && other.active_;
3703  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3704  return newval;
3705 }
3706 
3707 CLI11_INLINE Validator Validator::operator!() const {
3708  Validator newval;
3709  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = desc_function_;
3710  newval.desc_function_ = [dfunc1]() {
3711  auto str = dfunc1();
3712  return (!str.empty()) ? std::string("NOT ") + str : std::string{};
3713  };
3714  // Give references (will make a copy in lambda function)
3715  const std::function<std::string(std::string & res)> &f1 = func_;
3716 
3717  newval.func_ = [f1, dfunc1](std::string &test) -> std::string {
3718  std::string s1 = f1(test);
3719  if(s1.empty()) {
3720  return std::string("check ") + dfunc1() + " succeeded improperly";
3721  }
3722  return std::string{};
3723  };
3724  newval.active_ = active_;
3725  newval.application_index_ = application_index_;
3726  return newval;
3727 }
3728 
3729 CLI11_INLINE void
3730 Validator::_merge_description(const Validator &val1, const Validator &val2, const std::string &merger) {
3731 
3732  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc1 = val1.desc_function_;
3733  const std::function<std::string()> &dfunc2 = val2.desc_function_;
3734 
3735  desc_function_ = [=]() {
3736  std::string f1 = dfunc1();
3737  std::string f2 = dfunc2();
3738  if((f1.empty()) || (f2.empty())) {
3739  return f1 + f2;
3740  }
3741  return std::string(1, '(') + f1 + ')' + merger + '(' + f2 + ')';
3742  };
3743 }
3744 
3745 namespace detail {
3746 
3747 #if defined CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM && CLI11_HAS_FILESYSTEM > 0
3748 CLI11_INLINE path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
3749  std::error_code ec;
3750  auto filename = b::to_osstring(file); // BATTERY MODIFIED, TODO: Test if it actually works
3751  auto stat = std::filesystem::status(filename, ec); // BATTERY MODIFIED
3752  if(ec) {
3753  return path_type::nonexistent;
3754  }
3755  switch(stat.type()) {
3756  case std::filesystem::file_type::none: // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
3757  case std::filesystem::file_type::not_found:
3758  return path_type::nonexistent;
3759  case std::filesystem::file_type::directory:
3760  return path_type::directory;
3761  case std::filesystem::file_type::symlink:
3762  case std::filesystem::file_type::block:
3763  case std::filesystem::file_type::character:
3764  case std::filesystem::file_type::fifo:
3765  case std::filesystem::file_type::socket:
3766  case std::filesystem::file_type::regular:
3767  case std::filesystem::file_type::unknown:
3768  default:
3769  return path_type::file;
3770  }
3771 }
3772 #else
3773 CLI11_INLINE path_type check_path(const char *file) noexcept {
3774 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
3775  struct __stat64 buffer;
3776  if(_stat64(file, &buffer) == 0) {
3777  return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
3778  }
3779 #else
3780  struct stat buffer;
3781  if(stat(file, &buffer) == 0) {
3782  return ((buffer.st_mode & S_IFDIR) != 0) ? path_type::directory : path_type::file;
3783  }
3784 #endif
3785  return path_type::nonexistent;
3786 }
3787 #endif
3788 
3789 CLI11_INLINE ExistingFileValidator::ExistingFileValidator() : Validator("FILE") {
3790  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
3791  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
3792  if(path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
3793  return "File does not exist: " + filename;
3794  }
3795  if(path_result == path_type::directory) {
3796  return "File is actually a directory: " + filename;
3797  }
3798  return std::string();
3799  };
3800 }
3801 
3802 CLI11_INLINE ExistingDirectoryValidator::ExistingDirectoryValidator() : Validator("DIR") {
3803  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
3804  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
3805  if(path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
3806  return "Directory does not exist: " + filename;
3807  }
3808  if(path_result == path_type::file) {
3809  return "Directory is actually a file: " + filename;
3810  }
3811  return std::string();
3812  };
3813 }
3814 
3815 CLI11_INLINE ExistingPathValidator::ExistingPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(existing)") {
3816  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
3817  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
3818  if(path_result == path_type::nonexistent) {
3819  return "Path does not exist: " + filename;
3820  }
3821  return std::string();
3822  };
3823 }
3824 
3825 CLI11_INLINE NonexistentPathValidator::NonexistentPathValidator() : Validator("PATH(non-existing)") {
3826  func_ = [](std::string &filename) {
3827  auto path_result = check_path(filename.c_str());
3828  if(path_result != path_type::nonexistent) {
3829  return "Path already exists: " + filename;
3830  }
3831  return std::string();
3832  };
3833 }
3834 
3835 CLI11_INLINE IPV4Validator::IPV4Validator() : Validator("IPV4") {
3836  func_ = [](std::string &ip_addr) {
3837  auto result = CLI::detail::split(ip_addr, '.');
3838  if(result.size() != 4) {
3839  return std::string("Invalid IPV4 address must have four parts (") + ip_addr + ')';
3840  }
3841  int num = 0;
3842  for(const auto &var : result) {
3843  bool retval = detail::lexical_cast(var, num);
3844  if(!retval) {
3845  return std::string("Failed parsing number (") + var + ')';
3846  }
3847  if(num < 0 || num > 255) {
3848  return std::string("Each IP number must be between 0 and 255 ") + var;
3849  }
3850  }
3851  return std::string();
3852  };
3853 }
3854 
3855 } // namespace detail
3856 
3857 CLI11_INLINE FileOnDefaultPath::FileOnDefaultPath(std::string default_path, bool enableErrorReturn)
3858  : Validator("FILE") {
3859  func_ = [default_path, enableErrorReturn](std::string &filename) {
3860  auto path_result = detail::check_path(filename.c_str());
3861  if(path_result == detail::path_type::nonexistent) {
3862  std::string test_file_path = default_path;
3863  if(default_path.back() != '/' && default_path.back() != '\\') {
3864  // Add folder separator
3865  test_file_path += '/';
3866  }
3867  test_file_path.append(filename);
3868  path_result = detail::check_path(test_file_path.c_str());
3869  if(path_result == detail::path_type::file) {
3870  filename = test_file_path;
3871  } else {
3872  if(enableErrorReturn) {
3873  return "File does not exist: " + filename;
3874  }
3875  }
3876  }
3877  return std::string{};
3878  };
3879 }
3880 
3881 CLI11_INLINE AsSizeValue::AsSizeValue(bool kb_is_1000) : AsNumberWithUnit(get_mapping(kb_is_1000)) {
3882  if(kb_is_1000) {
3883  description("SIZE [b, kb(=1000b), kib(=1024b), ...]");
3884  } else {
3885  description("SIZE [b, kb(=1024b), ...]");
3886  }
3887 }
3888 
3889 CLI11_INLINE std::map<std::string, AsSizeValue::result_t> AsSizeValue::init_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
3890  std::map<std::string, result_t> m;
3891  result_t k_factor = kb_is_1000 ? 1000 : 1024;
3892  result_t ki_factor = 1024;
3893  result_t k = 1;
3894  result_t ki = 1;
3895  m["b"] = 1;
3896  for(std::string p : {"k", "m", "g", "t", "p", "e"}) {
3897  k *= k_factor;
3898  ki *= ki_factor;
3899  m[p] = k;
3900  m[p + "b"] = k;
3901  m[p + "i"] = ki;
3902  m[p + "ib"] = ki;
3903  }
3904  return m;
3905 }
3906 
3907 CLI11_INLINE std::map<std::string, AsSizeValue::result_t> AsSizeValue::get_mapping(bool kb_is_1000) {
3908  if(kb_is_1000) {
3909  static auto m = init_mapping(true);
3910  return m;
3911  }
3912  static auto m = init_mapping(false);
3913  return m;
3914 }
3915 
3916 namespace detail {
3917 
3918 CLI11_INLINE std::pair<std::string, std::string> split_program_name(std::string commandline) {
3919  // try to determine the programName
3920  std::pair<std::string, std::string> vals;
3921  trim(commandline);
3922  auto esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
3923  while(detail::check_path(commandline.substr(0, esp).c_str()) != path_type::file) {
3924  esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', esp + 1);
3925  if(esp == std::string::npos) {
3926  // if we have reached the end and haven't found a valid file just assume the first argument is the
3927  // program name
3928  if(commandline[0] == '"' || commandline[0] == '\'' || commandline[0] == '`') {
3929  bool embeddedQuote = false;
3930  auto keyChar = commandline[0];
3931  auto end = commandline.find_first_of(keyChar, 1);
3932  while((end != std::string::npos) && (commandline[end - 1] == '\\')) { // deal with escaped quotes
3933  end = commandline.find_first_of(keyChar, end + 1);
3934  embeddedQuote = true;
3935  }
3936  if(end != std::string::npos) {
3937  vals.first = commandline.substr(1, end - 1);
3938  esp = end + 1;
3939  if(embeddedQuote) {
3940  vals.first = find_and_replace(vals.first, std::string("\\") + keyChar, std::string(1, keyChar));
3941  }
3942  } else {
3943  esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
3944  }
3945  } else {
3946  esp = commandline.find_first_of(' ', 1);
3947  }
3948 
3949  break;
3950  }
3951  }
3952  if(vals.first.empty()) {
3953  vals.first = commandline.substr(0, esp);
3954  rtrim(vals.first);
3955  }
3956 
3957  // strip the program name
3958  vals.second = (esp < commandline.length() - 1) ? commandline.substr(esp + 1) : std::string{};
3959  ltrim(vals.second);
3960  return vals;
3961 }
3962 
3963 } // namespace detail
3965 
3966 
3967 
3968 
3969 class Option;
3970 class App;
3971 
3976 
3977 enum class AppFormatMode {
3978  Normal,
3979  All,
3980  Sub,
3981 };
3982 
3987 class FormatterBase {
3988  protected:
3991 
3993  std::size_t column_width_{30};
3994 
3997  std::map<std::string, std::string> labels_{};
3998 
4002 
4003  public:
4004  FormatterBase() = default;
4005  FormatterBase(const FormatterBase &) = default;
4006  FormatterBase(FormatterBase &&) = default;
4007  FormatterBase &operator=(const FormatterBase &) = default;
4008  FormatterBase &operator=(FormatterBase &&) = default;
4009 
4011  virtual ~FormatterBase() noexcept {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
4012 
4014  virtual std::string make_help(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode) const = 0;
4015 
4019 
4021  void label(std::string key, std::string val) { labels_[key] = val; }
4022 
4024  void column_width(std::size_t val) { column_width_ = val; }
4025 
4029 
4031  CLI11_NODISCARD std::string get_label(std::string key) const {
4032  if(labels_.find(key) == labels_.end())
4033  return key;
4034  return labels_.at(key);
4035  }
4036 
4038  CLI11_NODISCARD std::size_t get_column_width() const { return column_width_; }
4039 
4041 };
4042 
4044 class FormatterLambda final : public FormatterBase {
4045  using funct_t = std::function<std::string(const App *, std::string, AppFormatMode)>;
4046 
4048  funct_t lambda_;
4049 
4050  public:
4052  explicit FormatterLambda(funct_t funct) : lambda_(std::move(funct)) {}
4053 
4055  ~FormatterLambda() noexcept override {} // NOLINT(modernize-use-equals-default)
4056 
4058  std::string make_help(const App *app, std::string name, AppFormatMode mode) const override {
4059  return lambda_(app, name, mode);
4060  }
4061 };
4062 
4065 class Formatter : public FormatterBase {
4066  public:
4067  Formatter() = default;
4068  Formatter(const Formatter &) = default;
4069  Formatter(Formatter &&) = default;
4070  Formatter &operator=(const Formatter &) = default;
4071  Formatter &operator=(Formatter &&) = default;
4072 
4075 
4078  CLI11_NODISCARD virtual std::string
4079  make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional, std::vector<const Option *> opts) const;
4080 
4082  virtual std::string make_positionals(const App *app) const;
4083 
4085  std::string make_groups(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
4086 
4088  virtual std::string make_subcommands(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const;
4089 
4091  virtual std::string make_subcommand(const App *sub) const;
4092 
4094  virtual std::string make_expanded(const App *sub) const;
4095 
4097  virtual std::string make_footer(const App *app) const;
4098 
4100  virtual std::string make_description(const App *app) const;
4101 
4103  virtual std::string make_usage(const App *app, std::string name) const;
4104 
4106  std::string make_help(const App * /*app*/, std::string, AppFormatMode) const override;
4107 
4111 
4113  virtual std::string make_option(const Option *opt, bool is_positional) const {
4114  std::stringstream out;
4115  detail::format_help(
4116  out, make_option_name(opt, is_positional) + make_option_opts(opt), make_option_desc(opt), column_width_);
4117  return out.str();
4118  }
4119 
4121  virtual std::string make_option_name(const Option *, bool) const;
4122 
4124  virtual std::string make_option_opts(const Option *) const;
4125 
4127  virtual std::string make_option_desc(const Option *) const;
4128 
4130  virtual std::string make_option_usage(const Option *opt) const;
4131 
4133 };
