7466  return e.get_exit_code();
7467  }
7468 
7469  if(e.get_name() == "CallForVersion") {
7470  out << e.what() << std::endl;
7471  return e.get_exit_code();
7472  }
7473 
7474  if(e.get_exit_code() != static_cast<int>(ExitCodes::Success)) {
7475  if(failure_message_)
7476  err << failure_message_(this, e) << std::flush;
7477  }
7478 
7479  return e.get_exit_code();
7480 }
7481 
7482 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<const App *> App::get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(const App *)> &filter) const {
7483  std::vector<const App *> subcomms(subcommands_.size());
7484  std::transform(
7485  std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), std::begin(subcomms), [](const App_p &v) { return v.get(); });
7486 
7487  if(filter) {
7488  subcomms.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(subcomms),
7489  std::end(subcomms),
7490  [&filter](const App *app) { return !filter(app); }),
7491  std::end(subcomms));
7492  }
7493 
7494  return subcomms;
7495 }
7496 
7497 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<App *> App::get_subcommands(const std::function<bool(App *)> &filter) {
7498  std::vector<App *> subcomms(subcommands_.size());
7499  std::transform(
7500  std::begin(subcommands_), std::end(subcommands_), std::begin(subcomms), [](const App_p &v) { return v.get(); });
7501 
7502  if(filter) {
7503  subcomms.erase(
7504  std::remove_if(std::begin(subcomms), std::end(subcomms), [&filter](App *app) { return !filter(app); }),
7505  std::end(subcomms));
7506  }
7507 
7508  return subcomms;
7509 }
7510 
7511 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_excludes(Option *opt) {
7512  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(exclude_options_), std::end(exclude_options_), opt);
7513  if(iterator == std::end(exclude_options_)) {
7514  return false;
7515  }
7516  exclude_options_.erase(iterator);
7517  return true;
7518 }
7519 
7520 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_excludes(App *app) {
7521  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(exclude_subcommands_), std::end(exclude_subcommands_), app);
7522  if(iterator == std::end(exclude_subcommands_)) {
7523  return false;
7524  }
7525  auto *other_app = *iterator;
7526  exclude_subcommands_.erase(iterator);
7527  other_app->remove_excludes(this);
7528  return true;
7529 }
7530 
7531 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_needs(Option *opt) {
7532  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(need_options_), std::end(need_options_), opt);
7533  if(iterator == std::end(need_options_)) {
7534  return false;
7535  }
7536  need_options_.erase(iterator);
7537  return true;
7538 }
7539 
7540 CLI11_INLINE bool App::remove_needs(App *app) {
7541  auto iterator = std::find(std::begin(need_subcommands_), std::end(need_subcommands_), app);
7542  if(iterator == std::end(need_subcommands_)) {
7543  return false;
7544  }
7545  need_subcommands_.erase(iterator);
7546  return true;
7547 }
7548 
7549 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string App::help(std::string prev, AppFormatMode mode) const {
7550  if(prev.empty())
7551  prev = get_name();
7552  else
7553  prev += " " + get_name();
7554 
7555  // Delegate to subcommand if needed
7556  auto selected_subcommands = get_subcommands();
7557  if(!selected_subcommands.empty()) {
7558  return selected_subcommands.at(0)->help(prev, mode);
7559  }
7560  return formatter_->make_help(this, prev, mode);
7561 }
7562 
7563 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string App::version() const {
7564  std::string val;
7565  if(version_ptr_ != nullptr) {
7566  auto rv = version_ptr_->results();
7567  version_ptr_->clear();
7568  version_ptr_->add_result("true");
7569  try {
7570  version_ptr_->run_callback();
7571  } catch(const CLI::CallForVersion &cfv) {
7572  val = cfv.what();
7573  }
7574  version_ptr_->clear();
7575  version_ptr_->add_result(rv);
7576  }
7577  return val;
7578 }
7579 
7580 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<const Option *> App::get_options(const std::function<bool(const Option *)> filter) const {
7581  std::vector<const Option *> options(options_.size());
7582  std::transform(
7583  std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), std::begin(options), [](const Option_p &val) { return val.get(); });
7584 
7585  if(filter) {
7586  options.erase(std::remove_if(std::begin(options),
7587  std::end(options),
7588  [&filter](const Option *opt) { return !filter(opt); }),
7589  std::end(options));
7590  }
7591 
7592  return options;
7593 }
7594 
7595 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<Option *> App::get_options(const std::function<bool(Option *)> filter) {
7596  std::vector<Option *> options(options_.size());
7597  std::transform(
7598  std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), std::begin(options), [](const Option_p &val) { return val.get(); });
7599 
7600  if(filter) {
7601  options.erase(
7602  std::remove_if(std::begin(options), std::end(options), [&filter](Option *opt) { return !filter(opt); }),
7603  std::end(options));
7604  }
7605 
7606  return options;
7607 }
7608 
7609 CLI11_INLINE Option *App::get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) noexcept {
7610  for(Option_p &opt : options_) {
7611  if(opt->check_name(option_name)) {
7612  return opt.get();
7613  }
7614  }
7615  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7616  // also check down into nameless subcommands
7617  if(subc->get_name().empty()) {
7618  auto *opt = subc->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7619  if(opt != nullptr) {
7620  return opt;
7621  }
7622  }
7623  }
7624  return nullptr;
7625 }
7626 
7627 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE const Option *App::get_option_no_throw(std::string option_name) const noexcept {
7628  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7629  if(opt->check_name(option_name)) {
7630  return opt.get();
7631  }
7632  }
7633  for(const auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7634  // also check down into nameless subcommands
7635  if(subc->get_name().empty()) {
7636  auto *opt = subc->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
7637  if(opt != nullptr) {
7638  return opt;
7639  }
7640  }
7641  }
7642  return nullptr;
7643 }
7644 
7645 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::string App::get_display_name(bool with_aliases) const {
7646  if(name_.empty()) {
7647  return std::string("[Option Group: ") + get_group() + "]";
7648  }
7649  if(aliases_.empty() || !with_aliases) {
7650  return name_;
7651  }
7652  std::string dispname = name_;
7653  for(const auto &lalias : aliases_) {
7654  dispname.push_back(',');
7655  dispname.push_back(' ');
7656  dispname.append(lalias);
7657  }
7658  return dispname;
7659 }
7660 
7661 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE bool App::check_name(std::string name_to_check) const {
7662  std::string local_name = name_;
7663  if(ignore_underscore_) {
7664  local_name = detail::remove_underscore(name_);
7665  name_to_check = detail::remove_underscore(name_to_check);
7666  }
7667  if(ignore_case_) {
7668  local_name = detail::to_lower(name_);
7669  name_to_check = detail::to_lower(name_to_check);
7670  }
7671 
7672  if(local_name == name_to_check) {
7673  return true;
7674  }
7675  for(auto les : aliases_) { // NOLINT(performance-for-range-copy)
7676  if(ignore_underscore_) {
7677  les = detail::remove_underscore(les);
7678  }
7679  if(ignore_case_) {
7680  les = detail::to_lower(les);
7681  }
7682  if(les == name_to_check) {
7683  return true;
7684  }
7685  }
7686  return false;
7687 }
7688 
7689 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> App::get_groups() const {
7690  std::vector<std::string> groups;
7691 
7692  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7693  // Add group if it is not already in there
7694  if(std::find(groups.begin(), groups.end(), opt->get_group()) == groups.end()) {
7695  groups.push_back(opt->get_group());
7696  }
7697  }
7698 
7699  return groups;
7700 }
7701 
7702 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> App::remaining(bool recurse) const {
7703  std::vector<std::string> miss_list;
7704  for(const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string> &miss : missing_) {
7705  miss_list.push_back(std::get<1>(miss));
7706  }
7707  // Get from a subcommand that may allow extras
7708  if(recurse) {
7709  if(!allow_extras_) {
7710  for(const auto &sub : subcommands_) {
7711  if(sub->name_.empty() && !sub->missing_.empty()) {
7712  for(const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string> &miss : sub->missing_) {
7713  miss_list.push_back(std::get<1>(miss));
7714  }
7715  }
7716  }
7717  }
7718  // Recurse into subcommands
7719 
7720  for(const App *sub : parsed_subcommands_) {
7721  std::vector<std::string> output = sub->remaining(recurse);
7722  std::copy(std::begin(output), std::end(output), std::back_inserter(miss_list));
7723  }
7724  }
7725  return miss_list;
7726 }
7727 
7728 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string> App::remaining_for_passthrough(bool recurse) const {
7729  std::vector<std::string> miss_list = remaining(recurse);
7730  std::reverse(std::begin(miss_list), std::end(miss_list));
7731  return miss_list;
7732 }
7733 
7734 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::size_t App::remaining_size(bool recurse) const {
7735  auto remaining_options = static_cast<std::size_t>(std::count_if(
7736  std::begin(missing_), std::end(missing_), [](const std::pair<detail::Classifier, std::string> &val) {
7737  return val.first != detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK;
7738  }));
7739 
7740  if(recurse) {
7741  for(const App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
7742  remaining_options += sub->remaining_size(recurse);
7743  }
7744  }
7745  return remaining_options;
7746 }
7747 
7748 CLI11_INLINE void App::_validate() const {
7749  // count the number of positional only args
7750  auto pcount = std::count_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [](const Option_p &opt) {
7751  return opt->get_items_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size && !opt->nonpositional();
7752  });
7753  if(pcount > 1) {
7754  auto pcount_req = std::count_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [](const Option_p &opt) {
7755  return opt->get_items_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size && !opt->nonpositional() &&
7756  opt->get_required();
7757  });
7758  if(pcount - pcount_req > 1) {
7759  throw InvalidError(name_);
7760  }
7761  }
7762 
7763  std::size_t nameless_subs{0};
7764  for(const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
7765  app->_validate();
7766  if(app->get_name().empty())
7767  ++nameless_subs;
7768  }
7769 
7770  if(require_option_min_ > 0) {
7771  if(require_option_max_ > 0) {
7772  if(require_option_max_ < require_option_min_) {
7773  throw(InvalidError("Required min options greater than required max options", ExitCodes::InvalidError));
7774  }
7775  }
7776  if(require_option_min_ > (options_.size() + nameless_subs)) {
7777  throw(
7778  InvalidError("Required min options greater than number of available options", ExitCodes::InvalidError));
7779  }
7780  }
7781 }
7782 
7783 CLI11_INLINE void App::_configure() {
7784  if(default_startup == startup_mode::enabled) {
7785  disabled_ = false;
7786  } else if(default_startup == startup_mode::disabled) {
7787  disabled_ = true;
7788  }
7789  for(const App_p &app : subcommands_) {
7790  if(app->has_automatic_name_) {
7791  app->name_.clear();
7792  }
7793  if(app->name_.empty()) {
7794  app->fallthrough_ = false; // make sure fallthrough_ is false to prevent infinite loop
7795  app->prefix_command_ = false;
7796  }
7797  // make sure the parent is set to be this object in preparation for parse
7798  app->parent_ = this;
7799  app->_configure();
7800  }
7801 }
7802 
7803 CLI11_INLINE void App::run_callback(bool final_mode, bool suppress_final_callback) {
7804  pre_callback();
7805  // in the main app if immediate_callback_ is set it runs the main callback before the used subcommands
7806  if(!final_mode && parse_complete_callback_) {
7807  parse_complete_callback_();
7808  }
7809  // run the callbacks for the received subcommands
7810  for(App *subc : get_subcommands()) {
7811  if(subc->parent_ == this) {
7812  subc->run_callback(true, suppress_final_callback);
7813  }
7814  }
7815  // now run callbacks for option_groups
7816  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
7817  if(subc->name_.empty() && subc->count_all() > 0) {
7818  subc->run_callback(true, suppress_final_callback);
7819  }
7820  }
7821 
7822  // finally run the main callback
7823  if(final_callback_ && (parsed_ > 0) && (!suppress_final_callback)) {
7824  if(!name_.empty() || count_all() > 0 || parent_ == nullptr) {
7825  final_callback_();
7826  }
7827  }
7828 }
7829 
7830 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE bool App::_valid_subcommand(const std::string &current, bool ignore_used) const {
7831  // Don't match if max has been reached - but still check parents
7832  if(require_subcommand_max_ != 0 && parsed_subcommands_.size() >= require_subcommand_max_) {
7833  return parent_ != nullptr && parent_->_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used);
7834  }
7835  auto *com = _find_subcommand(current, true, ignore_used);
7836  if(com != nullptr) {
7837  return true;
7838  }
7839  // Check parent if exists, else return false
7840  return parent_ != nullptr && parent_->_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used);
7841 }
7842 
7843 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE detail::Classifier App::_recognize(const std::string &current,
7844  bool ignore_used_subcommands) const {
7845  std::string dummy1, dummy2;
7846 
7847  if(current == "--")
7848  return detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK;
7849  if(_valid_subcommand(current, ignore_used_subcommands))
7850  return detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND;
7851  if(detail::split_long(current, dummy1, dummy2))
7852  return detail::Classifier::LONG;
7853  if(detail::split_short(current, dummy1, dummy2)) {
7854  if(dummy1[0] >= '0' && dummy1[0] <= '9') {
7855  if(get_option_no_throw(std::string{'-', dummy1[0]}) == nullptr) {
7856  return detail::Classifier::NONE;
7857  }
7858  }
7859  return detail::Classifier::SHORT;
7860  }
7861  if((allow_windows_style_options_) && (detail::split_windows_style(current, dummy1, dummy2)))
7862  return detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE;
7863  if((current == "++") && !name_.empty() && parent_ != nullptr)
7864  return detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR;
7865  return detail::Classifier::NONE;
7866 }
7867 
7868 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_config_file() {
7869  if(config_ptr_ != nullptr) {
7870  bool config_required = config_ptr_->get_required();
7871  auto file_given = config_ptr_->count() > 0;
7872  auto config_files = config_ptr_->as<std::vector<std::string>>();
7873  if(config_files.empty() || config_files.front().empty()) {
7874  if(config_required) {
7875  throw FileError::Missing("no specified config file");
7876  }
7877  return;
7878  }
7879  for(auto rit = config_files.rbegin(); rit != config_files.rend(); ++rit) {
7880  const auto &config_file = *rit;
7881  auto path_result = detail::check_path(config_file.c_str());
7882  if(path_result == detail::path_type::file) {
7883  try {
7884  std::vector<ConfigItem> values = config_formatter_->from_file(config_file);
7885  _parse_config(values);
7886  if(!file_given) {
7887  config_ptr_->add_result(config_file);
7888  }
7889  } catch(const FileError &) {
7890  if(config_required || file_given)
7891  throw;
7892  }
7893  } else if(config_required || file_given) {
7894  throw FileError::Missing(config_file);
7895  }
7896  }
7897  }
7898 }
7899 
7900 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_env() {
7901  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7902  if(opt->count() == 0 && !opt->envname_.empty()) {
7903  char *buffer = nullptr;
7904  std::string ename_string;
7905 
7906 #ifdef _MSC_VER
7907  // Windows version
7908  std::size_t sz = 0;
7909  if(_dupenv_s(&buffer, &sz, opt->envname_.c_str()) == 0 && buffer != nullptr) {
7910  ename_string = std::string(buffer);
7911  free(buffer);
7912  }
7913 #else
7914  // This also works on Windows, but gives a warning
7915  buffer = std::getenv(opt->envname_.c_str());
7916  if(buffer != nullptr)
7917  ename_string = std::string(buffer);
7918 #endif
7919 
7920  if(!ename_string.empty()) {
7921  opt->add_result(ename_string);
7922  }
7923  }
7924  }
7925 
7926  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
7927  if(sub->get_name().empty() || !sub->parse_complete_callback_)
7928  sub->_process_env();
7929  }
7930 }
7931 
7932 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_callbacks() {
7933 
7934  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
7935  // process the priority option_groups first
7936  if(sub->get_name().empty() && sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
7937  if(sub->count_all() > 0) {
7938  sub->_process_callbacks();
7939  sub->run_callback();
7940  }
7941  }
7942  }
7943 
7944  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
7945  if((*opt) && !opt->get_callback_run()) {
7946  opt->run_callback();
7947  }
7948  }
7949  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
7950  if(!sub->parse_complete_callback_) {
7951  sub->_process_callbacks();
7952  }
7953  }
7954 }
7955 
7956 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_help_flags(bool trigger_help, bool trigger_all_help) const {
7957  const Option *help_ptr = get_help_ptr();
7958  const Option *help_all_ptr = get_help_all_ptr();
7959 
7960  if(help_ptr != nullptr && help_ptr->count() > 0)
7961  trigger_help = true;
7962  if(help_all_ptr != nullptr && help_all_ptr->count() > 0)
7963  trigger_all_help = true;
7964 
7965  // If there were parsed subcommands, call those. First subcommand wins if there are multiple ones.
7966  if(!parsed_subcommands_.empty()) {
7967  for(const App *sub : parsed_subcommands_)
7968  sub->_process_help_flags(trigger_help, trigger_all_help);
7969 
7970  // Only the final subcommand should call for help. All help wins over help.
7971  } else if(trigger_all_help) {
7972  throw CallForAllHelp();
7973  } else if(trigger_help) {
7974  throw CallForHelp();
7975  }
7976 }
7977 
7978 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_requirements() {
7979  // check excludes
7980  bool excluded{false};
7981  std::string excluder;
7982  for(const auto &opt : exclude_options_) {
7983  if(opt->count() > 0) {
7984  excluded = true;
7985  excluder = opt->get_name();
7986  }
7987  }
7988  for(const auto &subc : exclude_subcommands_) {
7989  if(subc->count_all() > 0) {
7990  excluded = true;
7991  excluder = subc->get_display_name();
7992  }
7993  }
7994  if(excluded) {
7995  if(count_all() > 0) {
7996  throw ExcludesError(get_display_name(), excluder);
7997  }
7998  // if we are excluded but didn't receive anything, just return
7999  return;
8000  }
8001 
8002  // check excludes
8003  bool missing_needed{false};
8004  std::string missing_need;
8005  for(const auto &opt : need_options_) {
8006  if(opt->count() == 0) {
8007  missing_needed = true;
8008  missing_need = opt->get_name();
8009  }
8010  }
8011  for(const auto &subc : need_subcommands_) {
8012  if(subc->count_all() == 0) {
8013  missing_needed = true;
8014  missing_need = subc->get_display_name();
8015  }
8016  }
8017  if(missing_needed) {
8018  if(count_all() > 0) {
8019  throw RequiresError(get_display_name(), missing_need);
8020  }
8021  // if we missing something but didn't have any options, just return
8022  return;
8023  }
8024 
8025  std::size_t used_options = 0;
8026  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8027 
8028  if(opt->count() != 0) {
8029  ++used_options;
8030  }
8031  // Required but empty
8032  if(opt->get_required() && opt->count() == 0) {
8033  throw RequiredError(opt->get_name());
8034  }
8035  // Requires
8036  for(const Option *opt_req : opt->needs_)
8037  if(opt->count() > 0 && opt_req->count() == 0)
8038  throw RequiresError(opt->get_name(), opt_req->get_name());
8039  // Excludes
8040  for(const Option *opt_ex : opt->excludes_)
8041  if(opt->count() > 0 && opt_ex->count() != 0)
8042  throw ExcludesError(opt->get_name(), opt_ex->get_name());
8043  }
8044  // check for the required number of subcommands
8045  if(require_subcommand_min_ > 0) {
8046  auto selected_subcommands = get_subcommands();
8047  if(require_subcommand_min_ > selected_subcommands.size())
8048  throw RequiredError::Subcommand(require_subcommand_min_);
8049  }
8050 
8051  // Max error cannot occur, the extra subcommand will parse as an ExtrasError or a remaining item.
8052 
8053  // run this loop to check how many unnamed subcommands were actually used since they are considered options
8054  // from the perspective of an App
8055  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8056  if(sub->disabled_)
8057  continue;
8058  if(sub->name_.empty() && sub->count_all() > 0) {
8059  ++used_options;
8060  }
8061  }
8062 
8063  if(require_option_min_ > used_options || (require_option_max_ > 0 && require_option_max_ < used_options)) {
8064  auto option_list = detail::join(options_, [this](const Option_p &ptr) {
8065  if(ptr.get() == help_ptr_ || ptr.get() == help_all_ptr_) {
8066  return std::string{};
8067  }
8068  return ptr->get_name(false, true);
8069  });
8070 
8071  auto subc_list = get_subcommands([](App *app) { return ((app->get_name().empty()) && (!app->disabled_)); });
8072  if(!subc_list.empty()) {
8073  option_list += "," + detail::join(subc_list, [](const App *app) { return app->get_display_name(); });
8074  }
8075  throw RequiredError::Option(require_option_min_, require_option_max_, used_options, option_list);
8076  }
8077 
8078  // now process the requirements for subcommands if needed
8079  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8080  if(sub->disabled_)
8081  continue;
8082  if(sub->name_.empty() && sub->required_ == false) {
8083  if(sub->count_all() == 0) {
8084  if(require_option_min_ > 0 && require_option_min_ <= used_options) {
8085  continue;
8086  // if we have met the requirement and there is nothing in this option group skip checking
8087  // requirements
8088  }
8089  if(require_option_max_ > 0 && used_options >= require_option_min_) {
8090  continue;
8091  // if we have met the requirement and there is nothing in this option group skip checking
8092  // requirements
8093  }
8094  }
8095  }
8096  if(sub->count() > 0 || sub->name_.empty()) {
8097  sub->_process_requirements();
8098  }
8099 
8100  if(sub->required_ && sub->count_all() == 0) {
8101  throw(CLI::RequiredError(sub->get_display_name()));
8102  }
8103  }
8104 }
8105 
8106 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process() {
8107  try {
8108  // the config file might generate a FileError but that should not be processed until later in the process
8109  // to allow for help, version and other errors to generate first.
8110  _process_config_file();
8111 
8112  // process env shouldn't throw but no reason to process it if config generated an error
8113  _process_env();
8114  } catch(const CLI::FileError &) {
8115  // callbacks and help_flags can generate exceptions which should take priority
8116  // over the config file error if one exists.
8117  _process_callbacks();
8118  _process_help_flags();
8119  throw;
8120  }
8121 
8122  _process_callbacks();
8123  _process_help_flags();
8124 
8125  _process_requirements();
8126 }
8127 
8128 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_extras() {
8129  if(!(allow_extras_ || prefix_command_)) {
8130  std::size_t num_left_over = remaining_size();
8131  if(num_left_over > 0) {
8132  throw ExtrasError(name_, remaining(false));
8133  }
8134  }
8135 
8136  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8137  if(sub->count() > 0)
8138  sub->_process_extras();
8139  }
8140 }
8141 
8142 CLI11_INLINE void App::_process_extras(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
8143  if(!(allow_extras_ || prefix_command_)) {
8144  std::size_t num_left_over = remaining_size();
8145  if(num_left_over > 0) {
8146  args = remaining(false);
8147  throw ExtrasError(name_, args);
8148  }
8149  }
8150 
8151  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8152  if(sub->count() > 0)
8153  sub->_process_extras(args);
8154  }
8155 }
8156 
8157 CLI11_INLINE void App::increment_parsed() {
8158  ++parsed_;
8159  for(App_p &sub : subcommands_) {
8160  if(sub->get_name().empty())
8161  sub->increment_parsed();
8162  }
8163 }
8164 
8165 CLI11_INLINE void App::_parse(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
8166  increment_parsed();
8167  _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8168  bool positional_only = false;
8169 
8170  while(!args.empty()) {
8171  if(!_parse_single(args, positional_only)) {
8172  break;
8173  }
8174  }
8175 
8176  if(parent_ == nullptr) {
8177  _process();
8178 
8179  // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
8180  _process_extras(args);
8181 
8182  // Convert missing (pairs) to extras (string only) ready for processing in another app
8183  args = remaining_for_passthrough(false);
8184  } else if(parse_complete_callback_) {
8185  _process_env();
8186  _process_callbacks();
8187  _process_help_flags();
8188  _process_requirements();
8189  run_callback(false, true);
8190  }
8191 }
8192 
8193 CLI11_INLINE void App::_parse(std::vector<std::string> &&args) {
8194  // this can only be called by the top level in which case parent == nullptr by definition
8195  // operation is simplified
8196  increment_parsed();
8197  _trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8198  bool positional_only = false;
8199 
8200  while(!args.empty()) {
8201  _parse_single(args, positional_only);
8202  }
8203  _process();
8204 
8205  // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
8206  _process_extras();
8207 }
8208 
8209 CLI11_INLINE void App::_parse_stream(std::istream &input) {
8210  auto values = config_formatter_->from_config(input);
8211  _parse_config(values);
8212  increment_parsed();
8213  _trigger_pre_parse(values.size());
8214  _process();
8215 
8216  // Throw error if any items are left over (depending on settings)
8217  _process_extras();
8218 }
8219 
8220 CLI11_INLINE void App::_parse_config(const std::vector<ConfigItem> &args) {
8221  for(const ConfigItem &item : args) {
8222  if(!_parse_single_config(item) && allow_config_extras_ == config_extras_mode::error)
8223  throw ConfigError::Extras(item.fullname());
8224  }
8225 }
8226 
8227 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_single_config(const ConfigItem &item, std::size_t level) {
8228  if(level < item.parents.size()) {
8229  try {
8230  auto *subcom = get_subcommand(item.parents.at(level));
8231  auto result = subcom->_parse_single_config(item, level + 1);
8232 
8233  return result;
8234  } catch(const OptionNotFound &) {
8235  return false;
8236  }
8237  }
8238  // check for section open
8239  if(item.name == "++") {
8240  if(configurable_) {
8241  increment_parsed();
8242  _trigger_pre_parse(2);
8243  if(parent_ != nullptr) {
8244  parent_->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(this);
8245  }
8246  }
8247  return true;
8248  }
8249  // check for section close
8250  if(item.name == "--") {
8251  if(configurable_ && parse_complete_callback_) {
8252  _process_callbacks();
8253  _process_requirements();
8254  run_callback();
8255  }
8256  return true;
8257  }
8258  Option *op = get_option_no_throw("--" + item.name);
8259  if(op == nullptr) {
8260  if(item.name.size() == 1) {
8261  op = get_option_no_throw("-" + item.name);
8262  }
8263  }
8264  if(op == nullptr) {
8265  op = get_option_no_throw(item.name);
8266  }
8267  if(op == nullptr) {
8268  // If the option was not present
8269  if(get_allow_config_extras() == config_extras_mode::capture)
8270  // Should we worry about classifying the extras properly?
8271  missing_.emplace_back(detail::Classifier::NONE, item.fullname());
8272  return false;
8273  }
8274 
8275  if(!op->get_configurable()) {
8276  if(get_allow_config_extras() == config_extras_mode::ignore_all) {
8277  return false;
8278  }
8279  throw ConfigError::NotConfigurable(item.fullname());
8280  }
8281 
8282  if(op->empty()) {
8283 
8284  if(op->get_expected_min() == 0) {
8285  if(item.inputs.size() <= 1) {
8286  // Flag parsing
8287  auto res = config_formatter_->to_flag(item);
8288  res = op->get_flag_value(item.name, res);
8289 
8290  op->add_result(res);
8291  return true;
8292  }
8293  if(static_cast<int>(item.inputs.size()) > op->get_items_expected_max()) {
8294  if(op->get_items_expected_max() > 1) {
8295  throw ArgumentMismatch::AtMost(item.fullname(), op->get_items_expected_max(), item.inputs.size());
8296  }
8297  throw ConversionError::TooManyInputsFlag(item.fullname());
8298  }
8299  }
8300  op->add_result(item.inputs);
8301  op->run_callback();
8302  }
8303 
8304  return true;
8305 }
8306 
8307 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_single(std::vector<std::string> &args, bool &positional_only) {
8308  bool retval = true;
8309  detail::Classifier classifier = positional_only ? detail::Classifier::NONE : _recognize(args.back());
8310  switch(classifier) {
8311  case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
8312  args.pop_back();
8313  positional_only = true;
8314  if((!_has_remaining_positionals()) && (parent_ != nullptr)) {
8315  retval = false;
8316  } else {
8317  _move_to_missing(classifier, "--");
8318  }
8319  break;
8320  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
8321  // treat this like a positional mark if in the parent app
8322  args.pop_back();
8323  retval = false;
8324  break;
8325  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
8326  retval = _parse_subcommand(args);
8327  break;
8328  case detail::Classifier::LONG:
8329  case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
8330  case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE:
8331  // If already parsed a subcommand, don't accept options_
8332  _parse_arg(args, classifier);
8333  break;
8334  case detail::Classifier::NONE:
8335  // Probably a positional or something for a parent (sub)command
8336  retval = _parse_positional(args, false);
8337  if(retval && positionals_at_end_) {
8338  positional_only = true;
8339  }
8340  break;
8341  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8342  default:
8343  throw HorribleError("unrecognized classifier (you should not see this!)");
8344  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8345  }
8346  return retval;
8347 }
8348 
8349 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE std::size_t App::_count_remaining_positionals(bool required_only) const {
8350  std::size_t retval = 0;
8351  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8352  if(opt->get_positional() && (!required_only || opt->get_required())) {
8353  if(opt->get_items_expected_min() > 0 && static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()) {
8354  retval += static_cast<std::size_t>(opt->get_items_expected_min()) - opt->count();
8355  }
8356  }
8357  }
8358  return retval;
8359 }
8360 
8361 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE bool App::_has_remaining_positionals() const {
8362  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8363  if(opt->get_positional() && ((static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()))) {
8364  return true;
8365  }
8366  }
8367 
8368  return false;
8369 }
8370 
8371 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_positional(std::vector<std::string> &args, bool haltOnSubcommand) {
8372 
8373  const std::string &positional = args.back();
8374 
8375  if(positionals_at_end_) {
8376  // deal with the case of required arguments at the end which should take precedence over other arguments
8377  auto arg_rem = args.size();
8378  auto remreq = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
8379  if(arg_rem <= remreq) {
8380  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8381  if(opt->get_positional() && opt->required_) {
8382  if(static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min()) {
8383  if(validate_positionals_) {
8384  std::string pos = positional;
8385  pos = opt->_validate(pos, 0);
8386  if(!pos.empty()) {
8387  continue;
8388  }
8389  }
8390 
8391  parse_order_.push_back(opt.get());
8393  if(opt->get_inject_separator()) {
8394  if(!opt->results().empty() && !opt->results().back().empty()) {
8395  opt->add_result(std::string{});
8396  }
8397  }
8398  if(opt->get_trigger_on_parse() &&
8399  opt->current_option_state_ == Option::option_state::callback_run) {
8400  opt->clear();
8401  }
8402  opt->add_result(positional);
8403  if(opt->get_trigger_on_parse()) {
8404  opt->run_callback();
8405  }
8406  args.pop_back();
8407  return true;
8408  }
8409  }
8410  }
8411  }
8412  }
8413  for(const Option_p &opt : options_) {
8414  // Eat options, one by one, until done
8415  if(opt->get_positional() &&
8416  (static_cast<int>(opt->count()) < opt->get_items_expected_min() || opt->get_allow_extra_args())) {
8417  if(validate_positionals_) {
8418  std::string pos = positional;
8419  pos = opt->_validate(pos, 0);
8420  if(!pos.empty()) {
8421  continue;
8422  }
8423  }
8424  if(opt->get_inject_separator()) {
8425  if(!opt->results().empty() && !opt->results().back().empty()) {
8426  opt->add_result(std::string{});
8427  }
8428  }
8429  if(opt->get_trigger_on_parse() && opt->current_option_state_ == Option::option_state::callback_run) {
8430  opt->clear();
8431  }
8432  opt->add_result(positional);
8433  if(opt->get_trigger_on_parse()) {
8434  opt->run_callback();
8435  }
8436  parse_order_.push_back(opt.get());
8437  args.pop_back();
8438  return true;
8439  }
8440  }
8441 
8442  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
8443  if((subc->name_.empty()) && (!subc->disabled_)) {
8444  if(subc->_parse_positional(args, false)) {
8445  if(!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
8446  subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8447  }
8448  return true;
8449  }
8450  }
8451  }
8452  // let the parent deal with it if possible
8453  if(parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
8454  return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_positional(args, static_cast<bool>(parse_complete_callback_));
8455 
8457  auto *com = _find_subcommand(args.back(), true, false);
8458  if(com != nullptr && (require_subcommand_max_ == 0 || require_subcommand_max_ > parsed_subcommands_.size())) {
8459  if(haltOnSubcommand) {
8460  return false;
8461  }
8462  args.pop_back();
8463  com->_parse(args);
8464  return true;
8465  }
8468  auto *parent_app = (parent_ != nullptr) ? _get_fallthrough_parent() : this;
8469  com = parent_app->_find_subcommand(args.back(), true, false);
8470  if(com != nullptr && (com->parent_->require_subcommand_max_ == 0 ||
8471  com->parent_->require_subcommand_max_ > com->parent_->parsed_subcommands_.size())) {
8472  return false;
8473  }
8474 
8475  if(positionals_at_end_) {
8476  throw CLI::ExtrasError(name_, args);
8477  }
8479  if(parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
8480  return false;
8481  }
8483  _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier::NONE, positional);
8484  args.pop_back();
8485  if(prefix_command_) {
8486  while(!args.empty()) {
8487  _move_to_missing(detail::Classifier::NONE, args.back());
8488  args.pop_back();
8489  }
8490  }
8491 
8492  return true;
8493 }
8494 
8495 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE App *
8496 App::_find_subcommand(const std::string &subc_name, bool ignore_disabled, bool ignore_used) const noexcept {
8497  for(const App_p &com : subcommands_) {
8498  if(com->disabled_ && ignore_disabled)
8499  continue;
8500  if(com->get_name().empty()) {
8501  auto *subc = com->_find_subcommand(subc_name, ignore_disabled, ignore_used);
8502  if(subc != nullptr) {
8503  return subc;
8504  }
8505  }
8506  if(com->check_name(subc_name)) {
8507  if((!*com) || !ignore_used)
8508  return com.get();
8509  }
8510  }
8511  return nullptr;
8512 }
8513 
8514 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_subcommand(std::vector<std::string> &args) {
8515  if(_count_remaining_positionals(/* required */ true) > 0) {
8516  _parse_positional(args, false);
8517  return true;
8518  }
8519  auto *com = _find_subcommand(args.back(), true, true);
8520  if(com != nullptr) {
8521  args.pop_back();
8522  if(!com->silent_) {
8523  parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
8524  }
8525  com->_parse(args);
8526  auto *parent_app = com->parent_;
8527  while(parent_app != this) {
8528  parent_app->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8529  if(!com->silent_) {
8530  parent_app->parsed_subcommands_.push_back(com);
8531  }
8532  parent_app = parent_app->parent_;
8533  }
8534  return true;
8535  }
8536 
8537  if(parent_ == nullptr)
8538  throw HorribleError("Subcommand " + args.back() + " missing");
8539  return false;
8540 }
8541 
8542 CLI11_INLINE bool App::_parse_arg(std::vector<std::string> &args, detail::Classifier current_type) {
8543 
8544  std::string current = args.back();
8545 
8546  std::string arg_name;
8547  std::string value;
8548  std::string rest;
8549 
8550  switch(current_type) {
8551  case detail::Classifier::LONG:
8552  if(!detail::split_long(current, arg_name, value))
8553  throw HorribleError("Long parsed but missing (you should not see this):" + args.back());
8554  break;
8555  case detail::Classifier::SHORT:
8556  if(!detail::split_short(current, arg_name, rest))
8557  throw HorribleError("Short parsed but missing! You should not see this");
8558  break;
8559  case detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE:
8560  if(!detail::split_windows_style(current, arg_name, value))
8561  throw HorribleError("windows option parsed but missing! You should not see this");
8562  break;
8563  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND:
8564  case detail::Classifier::SUBCOMMAND_TERMINATOR:
8565  case detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK:
8566  case detail::Classifier::NONE:
8567  default:
8568  throw HorribleError("parsing got called with invalid option! You should not see this");
8569  }
8570 
8571  auto op_ptr = std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [arg_name, current_type](const Option_p &opt) {
8572  if(current_type == detail::Classifier::LONG)
8573  return opt->check_lname(arg_name);
8574  if(current_type == detail::Classifier::SHORT)
8575  return opt->check_sname(arg_name);
8576  // this will only get called for detail::Classifier::WINDOWS_STYLE
8577  return opt->check_lname(arg_name) || opt->check_sname(arg_name);
8578  });
8579 
8580  // Option not found
8581  if(op_ptr == std::end(options_)) {
8582  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
8583  if(subc->name_.empty() && !subc->disabled_) {
8584  if(subc->_parse_arg(args, current_type)) {
8585  if(!subc->pre_parse_called_) {
8586  subc->_trigger_pre_parse(args.size());
8587  }
8588  return true;
8589  }
8590  }
8591  }
8592 
8593  // don't capture missing if this is a nameless subcommand and nameless subcommands can't fallthrough
8594  if(parent_ != nullptr && name_.empty()) {
8595  return false;
8596  }
8597 
8598  // If a subcommand, try the main command
8599  if(parent_ != nullptr && fallthrough_)
8600  return _get_fallthrough_parent()->_parse_arg(args, current_type);
8601 
8602  // Otherwise, add to missing
8603  args.pop_back();
8604  _move_to_missing(current_type, current);
8605  return true;
8606  }
8607 
8608  args.pop_back();
8609 
8610  // Get a reference to the pointer to make syntax bearable
8611  Option_p &op = *op_ptr;
8613  if(op->get_inject_separator()) {
8614  if(!op->results().empty() && !op->results().back().empty()) {
8615  op->add_result(std::string{});
8616  }
8617  }
8618  if(op->get_trigger_on_parse() && op->current_option_state_ == Option::option_state::callback_run) {
8619  op->clear();
8620  }
8621  int min_num = (std::min)(op->get_type_size_min(), op->get_items_expected_min());
8622  int max_num = op->get_items_expected_max();
8623  // check container like options to limit the argument size to a single type if the allow_extra_flags argument is
8624  // set. 16 is somewhat arbitrary (needs to be at least 4)
8625  if(max_num >= detail::expected_max_vector_size / 16 && !op->get_allow_extra_args()) {
8626  auto tmax = op->get_type_size_max();
8627  max_num = detail::checked_multiply(tmax, op->get_expected_min()) ? tmax : detail::expected_max_vector_size;
8628  }
8629  // Make sure we always eat the minimum for unlimited vectors
8630  int collected = 0; // total number of arguments collected
8631  int result_count = 0; // local variable for number of results in a single arg string
8632  // deal with purely flag like things
8633  if(max_num == 0) {
8634  auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, value);
8635  op->add_result(res);
8636  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8637  } else if(!value.empty()) { // --this=value
8638  op->add_result(value, result_count);
8639  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8640  collected += result_count;
8641  // -Trest
8642  } else if(!rest.empty()) {
8643  op->add_result(rest, result_count);
8644  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8645  rest = "";
8646  collected += result_count;
8647  }
8648 
8649  // gather the minimum number of arguments
8650  while(min_num > collected && !args.empty()) {
8651  std::string current_ = args.back();
8652  args.pop_back();
8653  op->add_result(current_, result_count);
8654  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8655  collected += result_count;
8656  }
8657 
8658  if(min_num > collected) { // if we have run out of arguments and the minimum was not met
8659  throw ArgumentMismatch::TypedAtLeast(op->get_name(), min_num, op->get_type_name());
8660  }
8661 
8662  // now check for optional arguments
8663  if(max_num > collected || op->get_allow_extra_args()) { // we allow optional arguments
8664  auto remreqpos = _count_remaining_positionals(true);
8665  // we have met the minimum now optionally check up to the maximum
8666  while((collected < max_num || op->get_allow_extra_args()) && !args.empty() &&
8667  _recognize(args.back(), false) == detail::Classifier::NONE) {
8668  // If any required positionals remain, don't keep eating
8669  if(remreqpos >= args.size()) {
8670  break;
8671  }
8672  if(validate_optional_arguments_) {
8673  std::string arg = args.back();
8674  arg = op->_validate(arg, 0);
8675  if(!arg.empty()) {
8676  break;
8677  }
8678  }
8679  op->add_result(args.back(), result_count);
8680  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8681  args.pop_back();
8682  collected += result_count;
8683  }
8684 
8685  // Allow -- to end an unlimited list and "eat" it
8686  if(!args.empty() && _recognize(args.back()) == detail::Classifier::POSITIONAL_MARK)
8687  args.pop_back();
8688  // optional flag that didn't receive anything now get the default value
8689  if(min_num == 0 && max_num > 0 && collected == 0) {
8690  auto res = op->get_flag_value(arg_name, std::string{});
8691  op->add_result(res);
8692  parse_order_.push_back(op.get());
8693  }
8694  }
8695  // if we only partially completed a type then add an empty string if allowed for later processing
8696  if(min_num > 0 && (collected % op->get_type_size_max()) != 0) {
8697  if(op->get_type_size_max() != op->get_type_size_min()) {
8698  op->add_result(std::string{});
8699  } else {
8700  throw ArgumentMismatch::PartialType(op->get_name(), op->get_type_size_min(), op->get_type_name());
8701  }
8702  }
8703  if(op->get_trigger_on_parse()) {
8704  op->run_callback();
8705  }
8706  if(!rest.empty()) {
8707  rest = "-" + rest;
8708  args.push_back(rest);
8709  }
8710  return true;
8711 }
8712 
8713 CLI11_INLINE void App::_trigger_pre_parse(std::size_t remaining_args) {
8714  if(!pre_parse_called_) {
8715  pre_parse_called_ = true;
8716  if(pre_parse_callback_) {
8717  pre_parse_callback_(remaining_args);
8718  }
8719  } else if(immediate_callback_) {
8720  if(!name_.empty()) {
8721  auto pcnt = parsed_;
8722  auto extras = std::move(missing_);
8723  clear();
8724  parsed_ = pcnt;
8725  pre_parse_called_ = true;
8726  missing_ = std::move(extras);
8727  }
8728  }
8729 }
8730 
8731 CLI11_INLINE App *App::_get_fallthrough_parent() {
8732  if(parent_ == nullptr) {
8733  throw(HorribleError("No Valid parent"));
8734  }
8735  auto *fallthrough_parent = parent_;
8736  while((fallthrough_parent->parent_ != nullptr) && (fallthrough_parent->get_name().empty())) {
8737  fallthrough_parent = fallthrough_parent->parent_;
8738  }
8739  return fallthrough_parent;
8740 }
8741 
8742 CLI11_NODISCARD CLI11_INLINE const std::string &App::_compare_subcommand_names(const App &subcom,
8743  const App &base) const {
8744  static const std::string estring;
8745  if(subcom.disabled_) {
8746  return estring;
8747  }
8748  for(const auto &subc : base.subcommands_) {
8749  if(subc.get() != &subcom) {
8750  if(subc->disabled_) {
8751  continue;
8752  }
8753  if(!subcom.get_name().empty()) {
8754  if(subc->check_name(subcom.get_name())) {
8755  return subcom.get_name();
8756  }
8757  }
8758  if(!subc->get_name().empty()) {
8759  if(subcom.check_name(subc->get_name())) {
8760  return subc->get_name();
8761  }
8762  }
8763  for(const auto &les : subcom.aliases_) {
8764  if(subc->check_name(les)) {
8765  return les;
8766  }
8767  }
8768  // this loop is needed in case of ignore_underscore or ignore_case on one but not the other
8769  for(const auto &les : subc->aliases_) {
8770  if(subcom.check_name(les)) {
8771  return les;
8772  }
8773  }
8774  // if the subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
8775  if(subc->get_name().empty()) {
8776  const auto &cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(subcom, *subc);
8777  if(!cmpres.empty()) {
8778  return cmpres;
8779  }
8780  }
8781  // if the test subcommand is an option group we need to check deeper
8782  if(subcom.get_name().empty()) {
8783  const auto &cmpres = _compare_subcommand_names(*subc, subcom);
8784  if(!cmpres.empty()) {
8785  return cmpres;
8786  }
8787  }
8788  }
8789  }
8790  return estring;
8791 }
8792 
8793 CLI11_INLINE void App::_move_to_missing(detail::Classifier val_type, const std::string &val) {
8794  if(allow_extras_ || subcommands_.empty()) {
8795  missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
8796  return;
8797  }
8798  // allow extra arguments to be places in an option group if it is allowed there
8799  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
8800  if(subc->name_.empty() && subc->allow_extras_) {
8801  subc->missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
8802  return;
8803  }
8804  }
8805  // if we haven't found any place to put them yet put them in missing
8806  missing_.emplace_back(val_type, val);
8807 }
8808 
8809 CLI11_INLINE void App::_move_option(Option *opt, App *app) {
8810  if(opt == nullptr) {
8811  throw OptionNotFound("the option is NULL");
8812  }
8813  // verify that the give app is actually a subcommand
8814  bool found = false;
8815  for(auto &subc : subcommands_) {
8816  if(app == subc.get()) {
8817  found = true;
8818  }
8819  }
8820  if(!found) {
8821  throw OptionNotFound("The Given app is not a subcommand");
8822  }
8823 
8824  if((help_ptr_ == opt) || (help_all_ptr_ == opt))
8825  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move help options");
8826 
8827  if(config_ptr_ == opt)
8828  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("cannot move config file options");
8829 
8830  auto iterator =
8831  std::find_if(std::begin(options_), std::end(options_), [opt](const Option_p &v) { return v.get() == opt; });
8832  if(iterator != std::end(options_)) {
8833  const auto &opt_p = *iterator;
8834  if(std::find_if(std::begin(app->options_), std::end(app->options_), [&opt_p](const Option_p &v) {
8835  return (*v == *opt_p);
8836  }) == std::end(app->options_)) {
8837  // only erase after the insertion was successful
8838  app->options_.push_back(std::move(*iterator));
8839  options_.erase(iterator);
8840  } else {
8841  throw OptionAlreadyAdded("option was not located: " + opt->get_name());
8842  }
8843  } else {
8844  throw OptionNotFound("could not locate the given Option");
8845  }
8846 }
8847 
8848 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOn(App *trigger_app, App *app_to_enable) {
8849  app_to_enable->enabled_by_default(false);
8850  app_to_enable->disabled_by_default();
8851  trigger_app->preparse_callback([app_to_enable](std::size_t) { app_to_enable->disabled(false); });
8852 }
8853 
8854 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOn(App *trigger_app, std::vector<App *> apps_to_enable) {
8855  for(auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
8856  app->enabled_by_default(false);
8857  app->disabled_by_default();
8858  }
8859 
8860  trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
8861  for(const auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
8862  app->disabled(false);
8863  }
8864  });
8865 }
8866 
8867 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOff(App *trigger_app, App *app_to_enable) {
8868  app_to_enable->disabled_by_default(false);
8869  app_to_enable->enabled_by_default();
8870  trigger_app->preparse_callback([app_to_enable](std::size_t) { app_to_enable->disabled(); });
8871 }
8872 
8873 CLI11_INLINE void TriggerOff(App *trigger_app, std::vector<App *> apps_to_enable) {
8874  for(auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
8875  app->disabled_by_default(false);
8876  app->enabled_by_default();
8877  }
8878 
8879  trigger_app->preparse_callback([apps_to_enable](std::size_t) {
8880  for(const auto &app : apps_to_enable) {
8881  app->disabled();
8882  }
8883  });
8884 }
8885 
8886 CLI11_INLINE void deprecate_option(Option *opt, const std::string &replacement) {
8887  Validator deprecate_warning{[opt, replacement](std::string &) {
8888  std::cout << opt->get_name() << " is deprecated please use '" << replacement
8889  << "' instead\n";
8890  return std::string();
8891  },
8892  "DEPRECATED"};
8893  deprecate_warning.application_index(0);
8894  opt->check(deprecate_warning);
8895  if(!replacement.empty()) {
8896  opt->description(opt->get_description() + " DEPRECATED: please use '" + replacement + "' instead");
8897  }
8898 }
8899 
8900 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App *app, Option *opt) {
8901  App temp;
8902  auto *option_copy = temp.add_option(opt->get_name(false, true))
8903  ->type_size(opt->get_type_size_min(), opt->get_type_size_max())
8904  ->expected(opt->get_expected_min(), opt->get_expected_max())
8905  ->allow_extra_args(opt->get_allow_extra_args());
8906 
8907  app->remove_option(opt);
8908  auto *opt2 = app->add_option(option_copy->get_name(false, true), "option has been retired and has no effect")
8909  ->type_name("RETIRED")
8910  ->default_str("RETIRED")
8911  ->type_size(option_copy->get_type_size_min(), option_copy->get_type_size_max())
8912  ->expected(option_copy->get_expected_min(), option_copy->get_expected_max())
8913  ->allow_extra_args(option_copy->get_allow_extra_args());
8914 
8915  Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string &) {
8916  std::cout << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name() << " is retired and has no effect\n";
8917  return std::string();
8918  },
8919  ""};
8920  retired_warning.application_index(0);
8921  opt2->check(retired_warning);
8922 }
8923 
8924 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App &app, Option *opt) { retire_option(&app, opt); }
8925 
8926 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App *app, const std::string &option_name) {
8927 
8928  auto *opt = app->get_option_no_throw(option_name);
8929  if(opt != nullptr) {
8930  retire_option(app, opt);
8931  return;
8932  }
8933  auto *opt2 = app->add_option(option_name, "option has been retired and has no effect")
8934  ->type_name("RETIRED")
8935  ->expected(0, 1)
8936  ->default_str("RETIRED");
8937  Validator retired_warning{[opt2](std::string &) {
8938  std::cout << "WARNING " << opt2->get_name() << " is retired and has no effect\n";
8939  return std::string();
8940  },
8941  ""};
8942  retired_warning.application_index(0);
8943  opt2->check(retired_warning);
8944 }
8945 
8946 CLI11_INLINE void retire_option(App &app, const std::string &option_name) { retire_option(&app, option_name); }
8947 
8948 namespace FailureMessage {
8949 
8950 CLI11_INLINE std::string simple(const App *app, const Error &e) {
8951  std::string header = std::string(e.what()) + "\n";
8952  std::vector<std::string> names;
8953 
8954  // Collect names
8955  if(app->get_help_ptr() != nullptr)
8956  names.push_back(app->get_help_ptr()->get_name());
8957 
8958  if(app->get_help_all_ptr() != nullptr)
8959  names.push_back(app->get_help_all_ptr()->get_name());
8960 
8961  // If any names found, suggest those
8962  if(!names.empty())
8963  header += "Run with " + detail::join(names, " or ") + " for more information.\n";
8964 
8965  return header;
8966 }
8967 
8968 CLI11_INLINE std::string help(const App *app, const Error &e) {
8969  std::string header = std::string("ERROR: ") + e.get_name() + ": " + e.what() + "\n";
8970  header += app->help();
8971  return header;
8972 }
8973 
8974 } // namespace FailureMessage
8975 
8976 
8977 
8978 
8979 namespace detail {
8980 
8981 std::string convert_arg_for_ini(const std::string &arg, char stringQuote = '"', char characterQuote = '\'');
8982 
8984 std::string ini_join(const std::vector<std::string> &args,
8985  char sepChar = ',',
8986  char arrayStart = '[',
8987  char arrayEnd = ']',
8988  char stringQuote = '"',
8989  char characterQuote = '\'');
8990 
8991 std::vector<std::string> generate_parents(const std::string &section, std::string &name, char parentSeparator);
8992 
8994 void checkParentSegments(std::vector<ConfigItem> &output, const std::string &currentSection, char parentSeparator);
8995 } // namespace detail
8996 
8997 
8998 
8999 
9000 namespace detail {
9001 
9002 CLI11_INLINE std::string convert_arg_for_ini(const std::string &arg, char stringQuote, char characterQuote) {
9003  if(arg.empty()) {
9004  return std::string(2, stringQuote);
9005  }
9006  // some specifically supported strings
9007  if(arg == "true" || arg == "false" || arg == "nan" || arg == "inf") {
9008  return arg;
9009  }
9010  // floating point conversion can convert some hex codes, but don't try that here
9011  if(arg.compare(0, 2, "0x") != 0 && arg.compare(0, 2, "0X") != 0) {
9012  double val = 0.0;
9013  if(detail::lexical_cast(arg, val)) {
9014  return arg;
9015  }
9016  }
9017  // just quote a single non numeric character
9018  if(arg.size() == 1) {
9019  return std::string(1, characterQuote) + arg + characterQuote;
9020  }
9021  // handle hex, binary or octal arguments
9022  if(arg.front() == '0') {
9023  if(arg[1] == 'x') {
9024  if(std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) {
9025  return (x >= '0' && x <= '9') || (x >= 'A' && x <= 'F') || (x >= 'a' && x <= 'f');
9026  })) {
9027  return arg;
9028  }
9029  } else if(arg[1] == 'o') {
9030  if(std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) { return (x >= '0' && x <= '7'); })) {
9031  return arg;
9032  }
9033  } else if(arg[1] == 'b') {
9034  if(std::all_of(arg.begin() + 2, arg.end(), [](char x) { return (x == '0' || x == '1'); })) {
9035  return arg;
9036  }
9037  }
9038  }
9039  if(arg.find_first_of(stringQuote) == std::string::npos) {
9040  return std::string(1, stringQuote) + arg + stringQuote;
9041  }
9042  return characterQuote + arg + characterQuote;
9043 }
9044 
9045 CLI11_INLINE std::string ini_join(const std::vector<std::string> &args,
9046  char sepChar,
9047  char arrayStart,
9048  char arrayEnd,
9049  char stringQuote,
9050  char characterQuote) {
9051  std::string joined;
9052  if(args.size() > 1 && arrayStart != '\0') {
9053  joined.push_back(arrayStart);
9054  }
9055  std::size_t start = 0;
9056  for(const auto &arg : args) {
9057  if(start++ > 0) {
9058  joined.push_back(sepChar);
9059  if(!std::isspace<char>(sepChar, std::locale())) {
9060  joined.push_back(' ');
9061  }
9062  }
9063  joined.append(convert_arg_for_ini(arg, stringQuote, characterQuote));
9064  }
9065  if(args.size() > 1 && arrayEnd != '\0') {
9066  joined.push_back(arrayEnd);
9067  }
9068  return joined;
9069 }
9070 
9071 CLI11_INLINE std::vector<std::string>
9072 generate_parents(const std::string &section, std::string &name, char parentSeparator) {
9073  std::vector<std::string> parents;
9074  if(detail::to_lower(section) != "default") {
9075  if(section.find(parentSeparator) != std::string::npos) {
9076  parents = detail::split(section, parentSeparator);
9077  } else {
9078  parents = {section};
9079  }
9080  }
9081  if(name.find(parentSeparator) != std::string::npos) {
9082  std::vector<std::string> plist = detail::split(name, parentSeparator);
9083  name = plist.back();
9084  detail::remove_quotes(name);
9085  plist.pop_back();
9086  parents.insert(parents.end(), plist.begin(), plist.end());
9087  }
9088 
9089  // clean up quotes on the parents
9090  for(auto &parent : parents) {
9091  detail::remove_quotes(parent);
9092  }
9093  return parents;
9094 }
9095 
9096 CLI11_INLINE void
9097 checkParentSegments(std::vector<ConfigItem> &output, const std::string &currentSection, char parentSeparator) {
9098 
9099  std::string estring;
9100  auto parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, estring, parentSeparator);
9101  if(!output.empty() && output.back().name == "--") {
9102  std::size_t msize = (parents.size() > 1U) ? parents.size() : 2;
9103  while(output.back().parents.size() >= msize) {
9104  output.push_back(output.back());
9105  output.back().parents.pop_back();
9106  }
9107 
9108  if(parents.size() > 1) {
9109  std::size_t common = 0;
9110  std::size_t mpair = (std::min)(output.back().parents.size(), parents.size() - 1);
9111  for(std::size_t ii = 0; ii < mpair; ++ii) {
9112  if(output.back().parents[ii] != parents[ii]) {
9113  break;
9114  }
9115  ++common;
9116  }
9117  if(common == mpair) {
9118  output.pop_back();
9119  } else {
9120  while(output.back().parents.size() > common + 1) {
9121  output.push_back(output.back());
9122  output.back().parents.pop_back();
9123  }
9124  }
9125  for(std::size_t ii = common; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
9126  output.emplace_back();
9127  output.back().parents.assign(parents.begin(), parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
9128  output.back().name = "++";
9129  }
9130  }
9131  } else if(parents.size() > 1) {
9132  for(std::size_t ii = 0; ii < parents.size() - 1; ++ii) {
9133  output.emplace_back();
9134  output.back().parents.assign(parents.begin(), parents.begin() + static_cast<std::ptrdiff_t>(ii) + 1);
9135  output.back().name = "++";
9136  }
9137  }
9138 
9139  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9140  output.emplace_back();
9141  output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
9142  output.back().name = "++";
9143 }
9144 } // namespace detail
9145 
9146 inline std::vector<ConfigItem> ConfigBase::from_config(std::istream &input) const {
9147  std::string line;
9148  std::string currentSection = "default";
9149  std::string previousSection = "default";
9150  std::vector<ConfigItem> output;
9151  bool isDefaultArray = (arrayStart == '[' && arrayEnd == ']' && arraySeparator == ',');
9152  bool isINIArray = (arrayStart == '\0' || arrayStart == ' ') && arrayStart == arrayEnd;
9153  bool inSection{false};
9154  char aStart = (isINIArray) ? '[' : arrayStart;
9155  char aEnd = (isINIArray) ? ']' : arrayEnd;
9156  char aSep = (isINIArray && arraySeparator == ' ') ? ',' : arraySeparator;
9157  int currentSectionIndex{0};
9158  while(getline(input, line)) {
9159  std::vector<std::string> items_buffer;
9160  std::string name;
9161 
9162  detail::trim(line);
9163  std::size_t len = line.length();
9164  // lines have to be at least 3 characters to have any meaning to CLI just skip the rest
9165  if(len < 3) {
9166  continue;
9167  }
9168  if(line.front() == '[' && line.back() == ']') {
9169  if(currentSection != "default") {
9170  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9171  output.emplace_back();
9172  output.back().parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, name, parentSeparatorChar);
9173  output.back().name = "--";
9174  }
9175  currentSection = line.substr(1, len - 2);
9176  // deal with double brackets for TOML
9177  if(currentSection.size() > 1 && currentSection.front() == '[' && currentSection.back() == ']') {
9178  currentSection = currentSection.substr(1, currentSection.size() - 2);
9179  }
9180  if(detail::to_lower(currentSection) == "default") {
9181  currentSection = "default";
9182  } else {
9183  detail::checkParentSegments(output, currentSection, parentSeparatorChar);
9184  }
9185  inSection = false;
9186  if(currentSection == previousSection) {
9187  ++currentSectionIndex;
9188  } else {
9189  currentSectionIndex = 0;
9190  previousSection = currentSection;
9191  }
9192  continue;
9193  }
9194 
9195  // comment lines
9196  if(line.front() == ';' || line.front() == '#' || line.front() == commentChar) {
9197  continue;
9198  }
9199 
9200  // Find = in string, split and recombine
9201  auto pos = line.find(valueDelimiter);
9202  if(pos != std::string::npos) {
9203  name = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(0, pos));
9204  std::string item = detail::trim_copy(line.substr(pos + 1));
9205  auto cloc = item.find(commentChar);
9206  if(cloc != std::string::npos) {
9207  item.erase(cloc, std::string::npos); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
9208  detail::trim(item);
9209  }
9210  if(item.size() > 1 && item.front() == aStart) {
9211  for(std::string multiline; item.back() != aEnd && std::getline(input, multiline);) {
9212  detail::trim(multiline);
9213  item += multiline;
9214  }
9215  items_buffer = detail::split_up(item.substr(1, item.length() - 2), aSep);
9216  } else if((isDefaultArray || isINIArray) && item.find_first_of(aSep) != std::string::npos) {
9217  items_buffer = detail::split_up(item, aSep);
9218  } else if((isDefaultArray || isINIArray) && item.find_first_of(' ') != std::string::npos) {
9219  items_buffer = detail::split_up(item);
9220  } else {
9221  items_buffer = {item};
9222  }
9223  } else {
9224  name = detail::trim_copy(line);
9225  auto cloc = name.find(commentChar);
9226  if(cloc != std::string::npos) {
9227  name.erase(cloc, std::string::npos); // NOLINT(readability-suspicious-call-argument)
9228  detail::trim(name);
9229  }
9230 
9231  items_buffer = {"true"};
9232  }
9233  if(name.find(parentSeparatorChar) == std::string::npos) {
9234  detail::remove_quotes(name);
9235  }
9236  // clean up quotes on the items
9237  for(auto &it : items_buffer) {
9238  detail::remove_quotes(it);
9239  }
9240 
9241  std::vector<std::string> parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, name, parentSeparatorChar);
9242  if(parents.size() > maximumLayers) {
9243  continue;
9244  }
9245  if(!configSection.empty() && !inSection) {
9246  if(parents.empty() || parents.front() != configSection) {
9247  continue;
9248  }
9249  if(configIndex >= 0 && currentSectionIndex != configIndex) {
9250  continue;
9251  }
9252  parents.erase(parents.begin());
9253  inSection = true;
9254  }
9255  if(!output.empty() && name == output.back().name && parents == output.back().parents) {
9256  output.back().inputs.insert(output.back().inputs.end(), items_buffer.begin(), items_buffer.end());
9257  } else {
9258  output.emplace_back();
9259  output.back().parents = std::move(parents);
9260  output.back().name = std::move(name);
9261  output.back().inputs = std::move(items_buffer);
9262  }
9263  }
9264  if(currentSection != "default") {
9265  // insert a section end which is just an empty items_buffer
9266  std::string ename;
9267  output.emplace_back();
9268  output.back().parents = detail::generate_parents(currentSection, ename, parentSeparatorChar);
9269  output.back().name = "--";
9270  while(output.back().parents.size() > 1) {
9271  output.push_back(output.back());
9272  output.back().parents.pop_back();
9273  }
9274  }
9275  return output;
9276 }
9277 
9278 CLI11_INLINE std::string
9279 ConfigBase::to_config(const App *app, bool default_also, bool write_description, std::string prefix) const {
9280  std::stringstream out;
9281  std::string commentLead;
9282  commentLead.push_back(commentChar);
9283  commentLead.push_back(' ');
9284 
9285  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9286  bool defaultUsed = false;
9287  groups.insert(groups.begin(), std::string("Options"));
9288  if(write_description && (app->get_configurable() || app->get_parent() == nullptr || app->get_name().empty())) {
9289  out << commentLead << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead, app->get_description()) << '\n';
9290  }
9291  for(auto &group : groups) {
9292  if(group == "Options" || group.empty()) {
9293  if(defaultUsed) {
9294  continue;
9295  }
9296  defaultUsed = true;
9297  }
9298  if(write_description && group != "Options" && !group.empty()) {
9299  out << '\n' << commentLead << group << " Options\n";
9300  }
9301  for(const Option *opt : app->get_options({})) {
9302 
9303  // Only process options that are configurable
9304  if(opt->get_configurable()) {
9305  if(opt->get_group() != group) {
9306  if(!(group == "Options" && opt->get_group().empty())) {
9307  continue;
9308  }
9309  }
9310  std::string name = prefix + opt->get_single_name();
9311  std::string value = detail::ini_join(
9312  opt->reduced_results(), arraySeparator, arrayStart, arrayEnd, stringQuote, characterQuote);
9313 
9314  if(value.empty() && default_also) {
9315  if(!opt->get_default_str().empty()) {
9316  value = detail::convert_arg_for_ini(opt->get_default_str(), stringQuote, characterQuote);
9317  } else if(opt->get_expected_min() == 0) {
9318  value = "false";
9319  } else if(opt->get_run_callback_for_default()) {
9320  value = "\"\""; // empty string default value
9321  }
9322  }
9323 
9324  if(!value.empty()) {
9325  if(!opt->get_fnames().empty()) {
9326  value = opt->get_flag_value(name, value);
9327  }
9328  if(write_description && opt->has_description()) {
9329  out << '\n';
9330  out << commentLead << detail::fix_newlines(commentLead, opt->get_description()) << '\n';
9331  }
9332  out << name << valueDelimiter << value << '\n';
9333  }
9334  }
9335  }
9336  }
9337  auto subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
9338  for(const App *subcom : subcommands) {
9339  if(subcom->get_name().empty()) {
9340  if(write_description && !subcom->get_group().empty()) {
9341  out << '\n' << commentLead << subcom->get_group() << " Options\n";
9342  }
9343  out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, prefix);
9344  }
9345  }
9346 
9347  for(const App *subcom : subcommands) {
9348  if(!subcom->get_name().empty()) {
9349  if(subcom->get_configurable() && app->got_subcommand(subcom)) {
9350  if(!prefix.empty() || app->get_parent() == nullptr) {
9351  out << '[' << prefix << subcom->get_name() << "]\n";
9352  } else {
9353  std::string subname = app->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar + subcom->get_name();
9354  const auto *p = app->get_parent();
9355  while(p->get_parent() != nullptr) {
9356  subname = p->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar + subname;
9357  p = p->get_parent();
9358  }
9359  out << '[' << subname << "]\n";
9360  }
9361  out << to_config(subcom, default_also, write_description, "");
9362  } else {
9363  out << to_config(
9364  subcom, default_also, write_description, prefix + subcom->get_name() + parentSeparatorChar);
9365  }
9366  }
9367  }
9368 
9369  return out.str();
9370 }
9371 
9372 
9373 
9374 
9375 
9376 
9377 CLI11_INLINE std::string
9378 Formatter::make_group(std::string group, bool is_positional, std::vector<const Option *> opts) const {
9379  std::stringstream out;
9380 
9381  out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
9382  for(const Option *opt : opts) {
9383  out << make_option(opt, is_positional);
9384  }
9385 
9386  return out.str();
9387 }
9388 
9389 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_positionals(const App *app) const {
9390  std::vector<const Option *> opts =
9391  app->get_options([](const Option *opt) { return !opt->get_group().empty() && opt->get_positional(); });
9392 
9393  if(opts.empty())
9394  return {};
9395 
9396  return make_group(get_label("Positionals"), true, opts);
9397 }
9398 
9399 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_groups(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const {
9400  std::stringstream out;
9401  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9402 
9403  // Options
9404  for(const std::string &group : groups) {
9405  std::vector<const Option *> opts = app->get_options([app, mode, &group](const Option *opt) {
9406  return opt->get_group() == group // Must be in the right group
9407  && opt->nonpositional() // Must not be a positional
9408  && (mode != AppFormatMode::Sub // If mode is Sub, then
9409  || (app->get_help_ptr() != opt // Ignore help pointer
9410  && app->get_help_all_ptr() != opt)); // Ignore help all pointer
9411  });
9412  if(!group.empty() && !opts.empty()) {
9413  out << make_group(group, false, opts);
9414 
9415  if(group != groups.back())
9416  out << "\n";
9417  }
9418  }
9419 
9420  return out.str();
9421 }
9422 
9423 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_description(const App *app) const {
9424  std::string desc = app->get_description();
9425  auto min_options = app->get_require_option_min();
9426  auto max_options = app->get_require_option_max();
9427  if(app->get_required()) {
9428  desc += " REQUIRED ";
9429  }
9430  if((max_options == min_options) && (min_options > 0)) {
9431  if(min_options == 1) {
9432  desc += " \n[Exactly 1 of the following options is required]";
9433  } else {
9434  desc += " \n[Exactly " + std::to_string(min_options) + "options from the following list are required]";
9435  }
9436  } else if(max_options > 0) {
9437  if(min_options > 0) {
9438  desc += " \n[Between " + std::to_string(min_options) + " and " + std::to_string(max_options) +
9439  " of the follow options are required]";
9440  } else {
9441  desc += " \n[At most " + std::to_string(max_options) + " of the following options are allowed]";
9442  }
9443  } else if(min_options > 0) {
9444  desc += " \n[At least " + std::to_string(min_options) + " of the following options are required]";
9445  }
9446  return (!desc.empty()) ? desc + "\n" : std::string{};
9447 }
9448 
9449 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_usage(const App *app, std::string name) const {
9450  std::stringstream out;
9451 
9452  out << get_label("Usage") << ":" << (name.empty() ? "" : " ") << name;
9453 
9454  std::vector<std::string> groups = app->get_groups();
9455 
9456  // Print an Options badge if any options exist
9457  std::vector<const Option *> non_pos_options =
9458  app->get_options([](const Option *opt) { return opt->nonpositional(); });
9459  if(!non_pos_options.empty())
9460  out << " [" << get_label("OPTIONS") << "]";
9461 
9462  // Positionals need to be listed here
9463  std::vector<const Option *> positionals = app->get_options([](const Option *opt) { return opt->get_positional(); });
9464 
9465  // Print out positionals if any are left
9466  if(!positionals.empty()) {
9467  // Convert to help names
9468  std::vector<std::string> positional_names(positionals.size());
9469  std::transform(positionals.begin(), positionals.end(), positional_names.begin(), [this](const Option *opt) {
9470  return make_option_usage(opt);
9471  });
9472 
9473  out << " " << detail::join(positional_names, " ");
9474  }
9475 
9476  // Add a marker if subcommands are expected or optional
9477  if(!app->get_subcommands(
9478  [](const CLI::App *subc) { return ((!subc->get_disabled()) && (!subc->get_name().empty())); })
9479  .empty()) {
9480  out << " " << (app->get_require_subcommand_min() == 0 ? "[" : "")
9481  << get_label(app->get_require_subcommand_max() < 2 || app->get_require_subcommand_min() > 1 ? "SUBCOMMAND"
9482  : "SUBCOMMANDS")
9483  << (app->get_require_subcommand_min() == 0 ? "]" : "");
9484  }
9485 
9486  out << std::endl;
9487 
9488  return out.str();
9489 }
9490 
9491 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_footer(const App *app) const {
9492  std::string footer = app->get_footer();
9493  if(footer.empty()) {
9494  return std::string{};
9495  }
9496  return "\n" + footer + "\n";
9497 }
9498 
9499 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_help(const App *app, std::string name, AppFormatMode mode) const {
9500 
9501  // This immediately forwards to the make_expanded method. This is done this way so that subcommands can
9502  // have overridden formatters
9503  if(mode == AppFormatMode::Sub)
9504  return make_expanded(app);
9505 
9506  std::stringstream out;
9507  if((app->get_name().empty()) && (app->get_parent() != nullptr)) {
9508  if(app->get_group() != "Subcommands") {
9509  out << app->get_group() << ':';
9510  }
9511  }
9512 
9513  out << make_description(app);
9514  out << make_usage(app, name);
9515  out << make_positionals(app);
9516  out << make_groups(app, mode);
9517  out << make_subcommands(app, mode);
9518  out << make_footer(app);
9519 
9520  return out.str();
9521 }
9522 
9523 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_subcommands(const App *app, AppFormatMode mode) const {
9524  std::stringstream out;
9525 
9526  std::vector<const App *> subcommands = app->get_subcommands({});
9527 
9528  // Make a list in definition order of the groups seen
9529  std::vector<std::string> subcmd_groups_seen;
9530  for(const App *com : subcommands) {
9531  if(com->get_name().empty()) {
9532  if(!com->get_group().empty()) {
9533  out << make_expanded(com);
9534  }
9535  continue;
9536  }
9537  std::string group_key = com->get_group();
9538  if(!group_key.empty() &&
9539  std::find_if(subcmd_groups_seen.begin(), subcmd_groups_seen.end(), [&group_key](std::string a) {
9540  return detail::to_lower(a) == detail::to_lower(group_key);
9541  }) == subcmd_groups_seen.end())
9542  subcmd_groups_seen.push_back(group_key);
9543  }
9544 
9545  // For each group, filter out and print subcommands
9546  for(const std::string &group : subcmd_groups_seen) {
9547  out << "\n" << group << ":\n";
9548  std::vector<const App *> subcommands_group = app->get_subcommands(
9549  [&group](const App *sub_app) { return detail::to_lower(sub_app->get_group()) == detail::to_lower(group); });
9550  for(const App *new_com : subcommands_group) {
9551  if(new_com->get_name().empty())
9552  continue;
9553  if(mode != AppFormatMode::All) {
9554  out << make_subcommand(new_com);
9555  } else {
9556  out << new_com->help(new_com->get_name(), AppFormatMode::Sub);
9557  out << "\n";
9558  }
9559  }
9560  }
9561 
9562  return out.str();
9563 }
9564 
9565 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_subcommand(const App *sub) const {
9566  std::stringstream out;
9567  detail::format_help(out, sub->get_display_name(true), sub->get_description(), column_width_);
9568  return out.str();
9569 }
9570 
9571 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_expanded(const App *sub) const {
9572  std::stringstream out;
9573  out << sub->get_display_name(true) << "\n";
9574 
9575  out << make_description(sub);
9576  if(sub->get_name().empty() && !sub->get_aliases().empty()) {
9577  detail::format_aliases(out, sub->get_aliases(), column_width_ + 2);
9578  }
9579  out << make_positionals(sub);
9580  out << make_groups(sub, AppFormatMode::Sub);
9581  out << make_subcommands(sub, AppFormatMode::Sub);
9582 
9583  // Drop blank spaces
9584  std::string tmp = detail::find_and_replace(out.str(), "\n\n", "\n");
9585  tmp = tmp.substr(0, tmp.size() - 1); // Remove the final '\n'
9586 
9587  // Indent all but the first line (the name)
9588  return detail::find_and_replace(tmp, "\n", "\n ") + "\n";
9589 }
9590 
9591 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_name(const Option *opt, bool is_positional) const {
9592  if(is_positional)
9593  return opt->get_name(true, false);
9594 
9595  return opt->get_name(false, true);
9596 }
9597 
9598 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_opts(const Option *opt) const {
9599  std::stringstream out;
9600 
9601  if(!opt->get_option_text().empty()) {
9602  out << " " << opt->get_option_text();
9603  } else {
9604  if(opt->get_type_size() != 0) {
9605  if(!opt->get_type_name().empty())
9606  out << " " << get_label(opt->get_type_name());
9607  if(!opt->get_default_str().empty())
9608  out << " [" << opt->get_default_str() << "] ";
9609  if(opt->get_expected_max() == detail::expected_max_vector_size)
9610  out << " ...";
9611  else if(opt->get_expected_min() > 1)
9612  out << " x " << opt->get_expected();
9613 
9614  if(opt->get_required())
9615  out << " " << get_label("REQUIRED");
9616  }
9617  if(!opt->get_envname().empty())
9618  out << " (" << get_label("Env") << ":" << opt->get_envname() << ")";
9619  if(!opt->get_needs().empty()) {
9620  out << " " << get_label("Needs") << ":";
9621  for(const Option *op : opt->get_needs())
9622  out << " " << op->get_name();
9623  }
9624  if(!opt->get_excludes().empty()) {
9625  out << " " << get_label("Excludes") << ":";
9626  for(const Option *op : opt->get_excludes())
9627  out << " " << op->get_name();
9628  }
9629  }
9630  return out.str();
9631 }
9632 
9633 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_desc(const Option *opt) const { return opt->get_description(); }
9634 
9635 CLI11_INLINE std::string Formatter::make_option_usage(const Option *opt) const {
9636  // Note that these are positionals usages
9637  std::stringstream out;
9638  out << make_option_name(opt, true);
9639  if(opt->get_expected_max() >= detail::expected_max_vector_size)
9640  out << "...";
9641  else if(opt->get_expected_max() > 1)
9642  out << "(" << opt->get_expected() << "x)";
9643 
9644  return opt->get_required() ? out.str() : "[" + out.str() + "]";
9645 }
9646 
9647 
9648 } // namespace CLI
